Reviews.Title: “Watch the Metro - and checking out”
Reviews.Author: headingtonroadrunner
Reviews.Content: We'd stayed here in 2004 and chose for our stay with friends from the US due to its location; it's a quick taxi ride from the Termini station. (Why not use the Metro? - see below). Staff were friendly in the tradition of Fellini's comment that 'Rome welcomes you when you come and forgets you when you go'. Restaurant felt more crowded than last time but the bar staff and porters were very helpful. Stay was marred by confusion on checkout; I'd reserved two rooms under my credit card and my friend paid on his card for it to appear they were unable to cancel the original reservation so that my friend appeared to have paid under his card while both rooms appeared on my statement; two weeks later we're only just sorting out. If you're booking for someone else then get them to do their reservation. Note this wasn't a problem at the hotel in Florence we'd come from. Later in the morning my friend had his passport stolen at the Termini station one Metro stop north by a gang of young girls; please read all the warnings and use a money belt. The general attitude is that this is part of the Rome 'experience', you will not be coming back so the impetus to do something about the root problem just isn't there. Although the US embassy were efficient, the police take the view of giving you the minimum paperwork and then wanting rid of you. Hotel were helpful in letting us to use their phones to call to cancel cards etc and get a copy of the passport (as hotels take a copy of the photo on arrival); streets around the hotel are fine for evening strolling but just remember you're in a capital city and you're a potential target. La Cicala e La Formica behind the hotel and Gli Angelotti 100 metres away are both good restuarants - with the latter the winner this time. The Ciuri-Ciuri chocolate orange ice cream behind the hotel was the clear winner

Reviews.Title: “Poor plumbing , Poor service Noisy,”
Reviews.Author: Saddened_12
Reviews.Content: Do not stay here !!!, The rooms have noisy toilets than run all night especially when the person above uses theirs. The street side rooms along via Cavour have windows that dont completely close so you hear noise from traffic and people all night long. The front desk staff are very rude. The wifi is at best, sporadic dial up.

Reviews.Title: “Not what I expected”
Reviews.Author: inlovewithd
Reviews.Content: I thought that out of all the hotels on my trip, this one would be the best because it is a four star hotel. The hotel is in a great location but it is not what I would expect for a four star. I don't have any major complaints.

Reviews.Title: “very good”
Reviews.Author: lmw048
Reviews.Content: we stayed at the Palatino for two nights. Our standard room (no 303) was facing the back - no particular view but obviously quieter than the front facing rooms. The bed was very wide and comfortable and the bathroom very clean though a bit small - but hey, this is the center of Rome!The hotel is in the middle of Via Cavour, halfway between the Forum and Termini Bus/train station. It is surrounded by cafes and restaurants of course. There is a subway stop very close. A tip: we parked our rented car for free in the next street on Saturday and Sunday and on Monday had to pay only half a Euro per hour and paid in advance for 8 hours!!! 4 Euros a day! The staff were very attentive and kind. When the waitress at breakfast saw that there is no more salad (we Israelis must have our vegetables for breakfast...) she ran off and brought us a plate full of cut up tomatoes! The head waiter was particularly caring about me because he saw I was sick. The lobby is quite nice and there is a big lounge with comfortable sofas to sit on and read. We tried room service - it was quick and promt and brought me my lemon tea very quickly for only 3 Euros! don't know about a/c because the weather didn't call for it.

Reviews.Title: “Average Accomodations”
Reviews.Author: Stephanie V
Reviews.Content: I thought this hotel was just average. It is very centrally located, but both the rooms/accommodations and the staff left much to be desired. No A/C and our room faced the main street so when we had to sleep with the window open (with no screen) it was really hard to sleep. It's literally a block from the Cavour metro and only a couple of blocks from several of the main ancient Roman ruins. The rooms are pretty spacious (European standards) but the furniture and decor are pretty antiquated (not like the photo in the profile). The staff was borderline rude and not very helpful at all. My guess is they are like this because a lot of tour groups seemed to stay there so they probably don't feel like they have to be overly accommodating. Overall, great location, but don't expect to be taken care of.

Reviews.Title: “Great room, location and service - should be ranked higher”
Reviews.Author: dman383
Reviews.Content: 15 min walk from train station, 5 min walk to colosseum and forum and right next to Cavour metro. Room is newly renovated, very large and comfortable bed, huge bathroom with rain shower/soaking tub. Manager on site very helpful when recommending sites. For price, should be ranked much higher on tripadvisor.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel but cold reception”
Reviews.Author: Scousepeasant
Reviews.Content: This is a nice hotel, centrally located & very handy for Cavour Metro Station. There are 2 breakfast rooms, one of which is small & quiet which means that it's possible to enjoy breakfast in a quiet space, despite the large tour groups which stay here. Our room faced the front of the hotel & there was some traffic noise, but that's to be expected. Though it might be worth asking for a room at the rear if this is likely to bother you. The rooms are a good size & there is a hairdryer in the bathroom, though no clothes iron. It's a shame, however, that when we arrived the reception staff made no attempt to smile. The man who dealt with us (Gianni) was poring over paperwork & eventually gave us his attention to start the check in process. We paid over 200 Euro a night plus city tax, yet it felt like we were an inconvenience. Later after we'd unpacked, my other half asked about the air conditioning. The man on reception curtly replied that this does not come on until 1st May. That wasn't a problem, but again there was no smile or effort to be courteous. I paid for internet access in the room but could only get access by taking my laptop to the lobby & working there. I didn't complain about this, but just accepted it. But one morning even that wouldn't work so I asked at reception & was told (again curtly) 'there is a problem with the server'. Again - the content of the message was fine, but the attitude was defensive, bordering on surly. Luckily on the day we checked out we were dealt with by a member of staff who had a pleasant attitude so we know that not all the staff are morose &/or defensive. We are not highly demanding or rude so the attitude of staff was a little puzzling. Away from reception the other staff were pleasant. So overall this is a nice hotel. But don't expect a warm welcome on arrival & be prepared for less than friendly service if you do need to contact the reception staff during your stay.

Reviews.Title: “Best location in Rome”
Reviews.Author: bigtravels
Reviews.Content: A perfect location, no better! Got to the airport, got the Terravision bus for 8euros return. Dropped us at the termini rail station, walked down the long street for about 15 mins to out hotel on the main stretch very close to the colluseum. We saw pretty much every attraction BY FOOT from here, the vatican, colluseum, trevi fountain, spanish steps, shops, ruins and your in the middle of a wide choice of restraunts. Would definatley pick this hotel again and would advise friends and family. Be advised that in Rome there is a random charge per person per night at the end of your stay for a 'city tax' (we paid approx £25 for 5 nights) keep this money back! Hotel staff wernt that friendly. We found that accross the board though in Rome, if you want super service and over friendlyness, go to Dubai/ america. Its as good as it gets in Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Clean hotel by the metro”
Reviews.Author: Alexeich007
Reviews.Content: There are 2 different room types in the hotel : refurbished and old one. We stayed in the old room with broken shower and street view. It was very noisy, I recommend ask for a room on the other side. Breakfast is very poor for 4* hotel, soluable coffe is ugly.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointed”
Reviews.Author: Tracy_HK
Reviews.Content: Stayed there fore three nights. Location is good, walking distance to all major attractions. Staff is not professional. I asked for map twice, first time they said they don't have it anymore. Second time they just refuse to give me even I saw they pass it to someone else. My friend asked for direction and the staff simply said they are busy??!!! Even staff in hostel won't answer like that!! The room is ok but stuffy and no air condition in the whole facility. As my room is facing to the street, it's too noisy to open the window at night. Won't suggest to stay there.

Reviews.Title: “Grand Hotel Palatino, Rome”
Reviews.Author: specshoes
Reviews.Content: Would definitely stay at this hotel again. Beautiful inside and out. Clean and modern. We had a suite which was beautifully appointed. Bathroom with large tub/shower combo plus and separate stall shower and double sinks. Location just a few minutes walk from the Colliseum, train/bus station, tour buses and literally hundreds of restaurants, snack bars, coffee bars, shops and gelato.

Reviews.Title: “Great value and very good location”
Reviews.Author: Paul_J1960
Reviews.Content: Great value for a hotel in Rome. Very comfortable bed and quiet hotel. The rooms on the first floor are of very high quality. The hotel is perfectly situated to visit the centre of Rome. Close to the Coliseo, walking distance from the shopping area. And if you prefer public transportation to go a bit further, it is just near an underground stop or the city shuttle buses.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: Ying690
Reviews.Content: I stayed here with a tour group -- that goes without saying that the hotel is conveniently located and efficient. Breakfast is included, which is necessary if you plan on walking all of Rome and you are on a budget, since food is generally expensive. It is walkable to major sights - the Roman Forum, the Colosseo, the Piazzza Venetia and the Vittorio Emmanuel Monument. It worked well for a big group. It is true, like other reviews that the staff can be abrupt. It can also be noisy, I needed to wear earplugs at night when the windows are open, but I heard that is true for most other hotels located in the city center. And yes, we had to open our windows in March because, all over Rome, AC/Heat cannot be turned on. It is the local law.

Reviews.Title: “Smart hotel, great location”
Reviews.Author: looptail
Reviews.Content: We stayed here one night as our original hotel had utility problems; as the room was paid for by the original hotel there is no comment on value/cost. Arrival: helpful reception staff - who spoke good English, which was appreciated - but the reception area was quite chaotic. Rooms: extremely smart - recently decorated to a high standard, very clean and comfortable and with very good facilities. Our room was at the back of the hotel so there was very little outside noise. Breakfast: good buffet with a good range of hot and cold dishes, including bacon, egg and Italian hams. Proper tea & coffee (no vending machines); can't fault it. Internet: not used. Wifi in rooms but requires payment. Area: very close to the Colosseum, very handy for the historic centre and easy to find. Plenty of restaurants close by. Connections: close to the Metro and bus stops - very well-connected. Overall: great stay.

Reviews.Title: “WE THINK THIS IS A GREAT PLACE TO STAY AT IN ROME”
Reviews.Author: advisorview
Reviews.Content: I am a return reviewer on this Hotel which just has a great location . The included breakfast has scrambled eggs, omelet squares, sausages, bacon that is in their style of not being cured, many breads, hams, salamis, vegetable table presentation and the condiments with coffee,toasts with jams. It is totally worth it and the same employee that has been there at the breakfast entrance for years. One large block as exiting the hotel to the left is the Coliseum. The high steps right across the street lead to St Peter of the Chains church with a Michaelangelo statue and there is no fee for this. It is all just jaw dropping in its artistic beauty. The a few blocks along the main street as you exit along the main street you can arrive to the roman ruins. If you walk left along this crossing main street you will arrive to an alley where many stores and restaurants along the way lead to the Trevi Fountain. If you go further you arrive at the Spanish Steps. It is all comfortable walking distance from this HOTEL. The tour groups use the Hotel so sometimes it can be crowdy and you may feel the attention is not there but we were helped with our luggage and every question was dealt with by the staff.There is a nice restaurant as you exit the hotel to the left about a block and a half. I loved the mussels and the wine was smooth. The head waiter however chooses who enters at times. The location, the value is great. Now in MARCH there is NO AIR CONDITIONING and the room can be warm. We opened the window to the alleyway and slept okay. There is airconditioning in the lobby area. Due to previous reviews on its bar, we stayed away from that area. However it may have changed due to the reviews.Sales are going on during this time in the stores and really when you have seen 2,000 and 4,000 euro prices in Paris and then come to the great styles here and pricings it is a wonderful treat and to have this Hotel in that experience just makes for a nice trip which is what we all want. You CANNOT beat the location. In case of an overflow there is a Hotel Solis further down the street which seems to not be used much. The bathroom is small and so is the room (we were assigned 806). The room is clean. I always leave a small tip of about $6 american money which they might change at their own desk.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location!”
Reviews.Author: Pablo G
Reviews.Content: This hotel is a perfect starting point to visit the centre of this wonderful city. The Palatino Grand Hotel is located almost in front of the Colosseum and close to Venice Square and Rome's major tourist attractions. The hotel was clean and comfortable, recently refurbished. Staff was friendly. I strongly recommend this hotel if you are planning to visit Rome.

Reviews.Title: “old style”
Reviews.Author: coxski
Reviews.Content: Love the look of the lounge and the "retro-style" bar. Once you go upstairs to the rooms you take a step back in time: the bathrooms are small and cramped (my toilet was too close to the sink), my bed was comfortable but the room was small and not very clean. Even though I was on the front (3rd floor), I didn't hear the traffic. The meeting rooms are well equipped (projectors, wifi, etc) and when we needed additional chairs, the personnel was quick to provide them. The breakfast buffet is rich and the service is good.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, large rooms”
Reviews.Author: 12skip
Reviews.Content: Palatino Grand Hotel in Rome is in a good location, just blocks from the Colosseum. The rooms were clean, large, and included a tub and shower in the bathroom. The lobby had plenty of seating and included a piano bar at one end. Overall the staff was friendly and helpful. Breakfast buffet area didn't seem quite big enough to accommodate all the guests -- maybe we were all trying to eat at the same time?

Reviews.Title: “great location!”
Reviews.Author: Ettacg
Reviews.Content: I Just spent 3 nights at the Palatino in Rome with my daughter. The staff was very friendly and also eager to help. Our room was immaculate and we had a beautiful view of the city. We were pleasantly surprise at the breakfast buffet, with choices for organic and non organic, and on request, a celiac kit which made our breakfast very enjoyable. The hotel was busy but we never felt neglected. The location is superb, we walk to the Coliseum and the area offered restaurants, shops etc. We had a great experience and I would strongly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Book another hotel”
Reviews.Author: andream114
Reviews.Content: First room smelled of bug spray, maybe that is why there was an exterminater van parked outside the hotel. The room was also very outdated and dirty for a four star hotel. We upgraded through Gate 1 travel and expected more from a four star hotel. The walls and door were covered with dingy red carpet and twin beds. The second room was renovated but was very stuffy and facing Via Cavour, so when the windows were open it was extremely noisy. Of the three hotels we stayed while in Italy, this was the most expensive and the most disappointing. We would not stay there again. If you already booked make sure you ask for a renovated room away from the street on the 7th or 8th floor. The only positive was breakfast and location. The people that gave good reviews must have stayed on the 7th or 8th floors!

Reviews.Title: “OK Hotel - Could do better”
Reviews.Author: dystrad1
Reviews.Content: We were moved to this hotel as our original choice had over booked. The hotel is well situated with excellent cafes and bars around in the back streets. The hotel staff are hit or miss. Some are helpful some are downright rude. The room was very small but clean. The beds were not full size singles and were small. The breakfast was awful. scramled eggs, mushy bacon, fruit, bread and cakes. The fruit juice was cheap. The coffee was excellent but that was it. It seems that this is the standard in Rome. An ok hotel On another note do yourself a favour and dont go to Rome. What a rip off full of con artists and beggers. Look at a bokk of Rome and you will see all you need to see. Barcelona had so much more to offer. Would never ever go back.

Reviews.Title: “Palatino Grand Hotel Rome”
Reviews.Author: DAVID B Posted by an Easytobook.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Booked and paid for an executive suite but was put in a standard double room on arrival which was extremely dirty. Went back to reception and said I didn't think this was an executive suite and they reluctantly agreed to move us to another room which probably just about met the executive status. No apology or reason given. We were ignored by reception staff after this.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect base for a great holiday!”
Reviews.Author: lconroy8
Reviews.Content: I have just returned from a family holiday and this hotel was excellent for us. The location was perfect, we walked everywhere from the coliseum to the trevi fountain but there is a metro station just beside the hotel if u want to travel further. I found the front desk staff extremely friendly and willing to help with restaurant recommendations, airport transfers, directions etc. I would definitely recommend this hotel and hope to stay there on returning to Rome soon!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location & Service”
Reviews.Author: Philip1029
Reviews.Content: I've been back to Rome every year since 2006 (my 7th visit will be in March 2012) and I consider the Palatino my home away from home. Besides the great location and service, the value is great. Rooms are fairly large for Europe and the amenities are good. The monti neighborhood has many nice restaurants and shops and is very pleasant for strolling. The hotel is within walking distance of major sites (e.g. Colosseum and Forum) and is down the street from the Cavour Metro station. Would recommend this hotel highly.

Reviews.Title: “Good Location, Acceptable Price, Excellent Hygiene”
Reviews.Author: SariSfere
Reviews.Content: Went to Rome with 2 friends, so we share 1 bedroom with 3 beds. The rooms are spacious, the toilets are clean with ample amenities. They also provide bide in the toilets. The location is the killer, as it is really within walking distance from the Colosseum, Domus Aurea and the Roman Forum. We ended up going to the Colosseum just about 3 times a day. The hotel is also quite near from the Central Station (Termini), which can be reached (walking) in about 20 minutes. Just go along Cafour and you'll find plenty of restaurants, gelateria and shops quite conviniently near from the Hotel. The staff are very friendly and helpful too. We then decided to stay at their sister hotel in central Florence and the front desk staff helped booked the room for us. Very recommended if you're traveling in mid-range budget.

Reviews.Title: “Recommended, excellent value for money”
Reviews.Author: Anatea
Reviews.Content: Located in Palatin hill, although not as central as some hotels, this hotel is in a comfortable walking distance of many attractions and very near to an underground station and Termini train station. We walked to every place. The rooms were spacious and nicely decorated, breakfast buffet was good and the staff very helpful and friendly.

Reviews.Title: “My stays at the Palatino”
Reviews.Author: Magister1946
Reviews.Content: I have been to Italia 16 times. I have stayed at the Grand Hotel Palatino on the Via Cavour in Rome at least 6 times. I would never stay anywhere else in Rome for the price. It is clean, efficient, and within 3 blocks of the Roman Forum and Colosseum.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location for Sight-seeing!”
Reviews.Author: wanderccat
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed in this hotel for 6 nights December 22-28, 2011. When we arrived in Rome around 9:00 AM after our overnight trans-atlantic flight we were exhausted. I realized they did not have to let us check into our room that early - so I was very pleasantly surprised when the man at the desk said he would check and see if our room was ready. He said, "yes, the room is ready and you are welcome to go on up." I thought the room was nice and roomy compared to a lot of rooms in Europe. The beds were very firm - which suited me just fine! Anyway, I collapsed on the bed and slept 4 hours! Later that afternoon, I was very happy to find that our hotel was situated in a very nice location for walks to the ruins, museums, churches, and piazzas (and ATMs). There were several very good restaurants and delis nearby also. Our stay was everthing I hoped it would be. I would recommend this hotel and I would stay here again in the future!

Reviews.Title: “Just what I was looking for...”
Reviews.Author: Maria B
Reviews.Content: This hotel is right down the street from the Colosseum and the Roman Forum and across the street from Saint Peter of the Chains where the extra large sculpture of Moses by Michelangelo resides. It is a comfortable room with nothing too special - but the price is right - and the food is great! We had Christmas dinner there, and it was a lovely gourmet meal. Close to Saint John's Laterano (Rome's mother church) and Saint Clemens, an historical wonder with three levels, one of which dates back to the 1st century AD and also includes a Mithraic Temple. Stones throw from Piazza Navona - a cab ride away from the Vatican. Walking distance from the Victor Emanuel Memorial - walk up to the higher level in the rear of the building at sunset and see a beautiful skyline.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, very good hotel”
Reviews.Author: FSR1977
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel 4 nights. The location is ideal, being right in the centre of Rome and within walking distance of the Colosseum, the Forum, the Trajan Markets, the Vittoriano and of a Metro station. Quite a few good restaurants around as well, but go a couple of streets away from the Via Cavour and its tourist traps. Lots of good gelaterias on Via Cavour, especially the one towards the end of Via Cavour, near the Largo Corrado Ricci. We were on the fourth floor, facing the back. The bed was comfortable and huuuuuge (super king size). The room was clean, tidy and turned down every night, as you'd expect. The room was functional, with enough space to move around and ample storage space. Full height mirrors as well. The breakfast was good. We booked this hotel through www.lastminute.com and decided it was preferable to pay the extra for a city centre hotel than all the ones further out in the Eur district, among others. What we saved in train and Metro tickets by being in the centre paid for the extra that the hotel cost. Rome is the sort of city that is relatively easy to get around on foot. The rate was perfectly reasonable (although I can't remember it, sorry!) and what you'd expect from a 4-star hotel. The hotel staff were courteous and helpful, helping with a couple of restaurant recommendations and with a plug adapter (mine disintegrated itself in my bag). I don't know how some people posting here had a bad experience in this hotel, but we really liked it and intend to go stay here again next year.

Reviews.Title: “Great value, had a wonderful stay!”
Reviews.Author: aceofspies
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Grand Palatino in the first week of December and had a wonderful time. Ignore the negative comments that people have posted on here as they nearly put us off... they shouldn't have. It was lovely. The room was clean, tidy, refreshed daily. The bed was two twin beds put together, but they were not on rollers as some reviews have stated. Decor was good and had a modern feel to it. We stayed on the 7th floor, with a view to the front of the hotel. Breakfast was very good, lovely eggs and bacon (boiled and scrambled eggs) on the buffet, along with cold meats, cheese, pastries, yoghurts, cereals, toast, smoothies, fruit, and good coffee (espresso) and tea (Twinings). The hotel staff were friendly/helpful, check out time is midday and there is a facility to leave bags after check out. The location of the hotel is perfect for the Colluseum/Forum/Palatine Hill as it's just a 5 minute walk away. Also access to the hotel from the airport is very good as trains/buses stop at the Termini station at the top of the via Cavour. It's a 20 minute walk from the hotel (we did this with our cases... on wheels). As for the rest of the city, well we did it all on foot. Not for everyone, but we managed it. With a bit of planning it can be done (wear comfy shoes!) Eating out is good, we found some great little places to eat close to the hotel, the best advice we received was "look for the places that are full of Italian people", we did this and got great food, for great prices. Also, ask about the house red wine, it'll be cheaper and doesn't often feature on the menu! Also, there are a number of gelaterias (ice cream parlours) in the local area, lovely! Would not hesitate in recommending this hotel for value and location.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, around the corner from the Colosseum.”
Reviews.Author: sylviann55
Reviews.Content: Very nice hotel, we ate in the dining room every night and the food was good. Rooms and bathrooms were very clean and spacious for Roma. Giancarlo at the front desk was very helpful as was the rest of the staff. The dinning room was a bit rushed at times, but they went out of their way to make sure we were taken care of upon returning from a trip out to our families hometown. We felt very safe in walking around the area and could go out a night looking at sights. This is a hotel that I would highly recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location Great Stay”
Reviews.Author: pupepause
Reviews.Content: This hotel was referred by my sister and brother-in-law who stayed there in 2005. We were very pleased with their recommendation. Our stay was for three nights. Our room was on the top floor (8) hardwood floors, nice bathroom and had a lovely balcony. The location is outstanding! We have come to have very low expectations traveling in Europe when it comes to hotels but the Palatino Grand help us higher our expections. The breakfast was excellent. There lots of tour groups staying at the hotel which did not interfere with our stay. We discovered the key to a good hotel room in Europe is to stay at a 4 Star hotel. They run anywhere from $350-400 a night USD but worth it on our book. We booked on- line early and that saved us some money and were able to get free internet service which is not the case in many of the European hotels. We also hired a certified tour guide who was also recommended before we arrived and she was EXCELLENT and well worth it. Easy to understand, full of energy and a wealth of knowledge and ideas while in Rome. Laria.....cspiut@tin.it

Reviews.Title: “Outdated and over rated!”
Reviews.Author: sandocious
Reviews.Content: I don't know how this is a 4 star hotel. The only thing good about this hotel was the location. Walking distance to/from the train station and the coliseum. I would not recommended this hotel to anyone!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for our needs”
Reviews.Author: ghhtooth
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 4 nights as part of a tour. Rooms were small but servicable, particularily since we only slept in the room. The location was great. You could walk to the colosseum/forum. Near public transportation and the desk will call a cab for you. Our biggest complaint would be the "front desk" workers except Roberto in the evening. Every time we asked a question we were treated as though we were intruding on "their" time. It made one feel very uncomfortable to ask anything. There are many restaurants on Via Caavour as well as on the little streets behind the Hotel. The breakfast was the least appealing of all the Hotels we stayed in, but enough choices to please most people. We would stay here again if we were in Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location -- good value”
Reviews.Author: salsasenora
Reviews.Content: A nice hotel with fabulous location near Colosseum/forum, and a short stroll from Metro station. Up and down the street are endless restaurants, gelaterias, and shops. Grand Hotel Palatino was included in our tour. There was a heat wave and the A/C in our room didn't work at all; it was unbearable. We got no cooperation from front desk, but they finally gave us a tower fan that they were using for themselves. Next day, Gian Carlo changed our room and our last two nights were wonderful Very comfortable bed (or very tired tourists?), and general amenities. The full breakfast buffet was pretty good, with bacon not raw, scrambled eggs with taste, and variety of meats, cheeses, cereals, yougarts, juices to make most happy. There is a nice side "lobby" where you can sit to update your travel journal, catch up with friends, or have a drink. When in Rome, there are so many awesome things to see and do, the hotel is mainly for recharging for the next day's adventures.

Reviews.Title: “Will Stay there when we return to Rome”
Reviews.Author: NottinghamPsb
Reviews.Content: This hotel was excellent, good atmosphere, great local and nice breakfast. Bar in the evening was always buzzing. 15 minutes leisurely walk from the best sights and 5 minutes walk from one of the best restaurants I have ever eaten in, Ristorante Argentino, steaks to die for. The nearest metro, Cavour, was 3 minutes walk away, very handy if you have been walking all day! We booked a standard double room but were given a suite on checking in as I had sadly had my purse stolen on the way to the hotel, something to beware of on the Metro. The suite was enormous and had its own balcony looking straight out onto a busy road but we never heard any noise from it at all. Would defiantly recommend the place and will be staying then when we next visit the wonder City of Rome

Reviews.Title: “Expencive hotel but not perfect”
Reviews.Author: piton5318
Reviews.Content: Stayed in twin room for three nights with my wife. Room was spotless, breakfast was not good considering it is a budget hotel, and a great location(historical center) - short walk along to metro station, nearly Coloseum.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic location for the colloseum and roman forum”
Reviews.Author: Nav531
Reviews.Content: Stayed two nights with a last minute booking on hotels.com and only paid 146 plus taxes for a fourt star. Lobby was beautiful and they efficiently placed in a room on the fourth floor. Breakfast is included, buffet style and very basic bit enough to get you started. Less than 10 mins walking to the colosseum and both red and blue lines. Room was decent nothing special but clean, big safe for your belongings and bed was comfortable. Would Reccomend to stay again (for the price you can't eat this location)

Reviews.Title: “Convenient Location for sites and Transport”
Reviews.Author: st8sman
Reviews.Content: This conveniently located hotel provided a generally comfortable base although the quality of the air conditioning varied from room to room. Rooms at the front suffered from some street noise and ambulances and their sirens regularly pass the hotel. There was a broad variety of items for breakfast which were spread all around the breakfast room. Staff were helpful and while I hesitate to recommend the hotel to others I will be happy to return there myself.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome respite in Roma”
Reviews.Author: gottagetawayBoston
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a 12 day Virgin Vacation package which included this hotel at the end of a London-Paris-Rome trip, and it was all that we hoped for and more. The staff was friendly, our rooms were ready when we arrived at noon, the rooms were freshly redecorated and new, all 3 of them, and all was quite comfortable and clean. Would recommend if you are interested in being in Rome, a 20 min walk to the train terminal, 10 minutes to the Coliseum and many other ancient ruins.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Location and Very Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Runner1018
Reviews.Content: My sisters and I (all in our 40's and 50's) stayed here as part of an escorted tour of Italy. The hotel is in an excellent location! It's about two blocks from the Colossium and across the street (sort of) from St. Peter In Chains Church. The rooms were not big but not tiny either. The beds were comfortable. I have two minor complaints. One is that the vent in the bathroom went directly into the room next to us. I could hear the people talking in their bathroom as clearly as if they were standing next to me - kind of creepy. The other complaint is that they don't provide irons (we asked for one to be taken to our room and were told "no" because it would blow a fuse). Okay, I can understand that but they wanted 6 euros for each piece they ironed! We felt that was a rip off so we hung our clothes on hangers in the bathroom when we showered so that the steam would get the wrinkles out - it worked well enough. Would I stay here again? Yes - because of the location.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it and would highly recommend!”
Reviews.Author: runjnee
Reviews.Content: A very comfortable hotel, and a wonderful experience. Staff were very friendly and helpful. The breakfast was incredible, and the room was so very lovely. The location is perfect for travelling around - it's right next to the Colosseum and a metro stop - and the staff are very cooperative with directions and advice. It made our experience so very nice, and we would definitely return when travelling to Rome next.

Reviews.Title: “Location, location, location...”
Reviews.Author: sbethb4
Reviews.Content: This was our second time staying here. We got a room on the 8th floor with a balcony. It was fantastic! Loved the room, very large for an Italian hotel or American hotel for that matter. The staff was mostly very friendly and helpful. The location can't be beat, its walking distance from everything in the city and is a great hotel for travelers. Couldn't have been happier with this hotel on this years Rome vacation. One suggestion though....bring something for your own wake up or set two calls, ours were late everyday and didn't get one of them at all. Otherwise, a great stay

Reviews.Title: “Great location!”
Reviews.Author: poohbearRowlett
Reviews.Content: Room clean and comfortable; location was great... I get lost easily, but this hotel was just down from the Colosseum, so no problems; the staff was so nice... I had to get up obscenely early for my flight home, and they packed me a box breakfast to take along!

Reviews.Title: “A great place to start your visit to Italy”
Reviews.Author: farrawaytravel
Reviews.Content: As part of a vacation tour package, we stayed here for 3 nights. Our room was on the 8th floor. It was spacious, modern, and accomodating for three people. We also enjoyed a balcony, which we used every night. The room was clean and met our needs completely. We enjoyed a bountiful breakfast buffet each morning, and never had any problems our entire stay. The hotel is in very close walking range to major sites in Rome, including the Colosseum, St. Peter's in Chains, the Forum and the National Monument of Victor Emmanuel II. You can also easily visit the Jewish Ghetto and walk to the Tiber River. There are also numerous restaurants, grocery and pharmacias in close proximity.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel”
Reviews.Author: AyannaFlorida
Reviews.Content: Gate 1 Travel booked this hotel for us when we were in Rome and it was great. Wonderful, central location. Close walking distance to the Colosseum. Has beautiful rooms and lobby. Close to a lot of restaurants.

Reviews.Title: “My last stay here!”
Reviews.Author: Katlowry
Reviews.Content: I've stayed at the Palatino many times and when I book online I get a better deal than when I book a group that is planning on dining there as well. I felt the staff was indifferent to our needs if not just downright unpleasant. Seeing as I had 20 people there for 3 nights you'd think we'd get a little preferential treatment. Not even which was such a shame since this hotel has so much potential!! There are a few rooms renovated that are beautiful and the location is terrific. The food beyond the pasta is second rate and the bar overcharges on their drinks so double check your tab! Above all the internet is a major rip off!!!

Reviews.Title: “We loved it and we'll be back”
Reviews.Author: FRANKD_11
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 4 nites May14 thru May 18 2011..Staffed very professional...Hotel very clean and bright...Room nice size no complaints very clean...Location great access to every part of Rome via metro/bus/walk.....

Reviews.Title: “Staff so friendly to non-Italian speaking Americans.”
Reviews.Author: Twithoutm
Reviews.Content: Staff was bilingual. Very friendly. Location just steps from colloseum and metro. Will definately recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Location, ...., and Nothing Else”
Reviews.Author: pmohanram
Reviews.Content: Only Positive Amazing Location : 5 mins from Coliseum, Forum, 2 minutes from St Peter in Chains Church (with Michelangelo's Moses Statue), 2 mins from Metro, 10 mins from termini, Nice restaurants all around Negatives Not worth 150 Euros a night Dingy appearance Small rooms, smaller bathrooms AC Turned off at nights Sketchy and unfriendly service Breakfast really average and monotonous Ripoff Internet (25 euros a day)

Reviews.Title: “Great Location - Very Outdated Rooms”
Reviews.Author: rea22
Reviews.Content: My husband and I arrived at the Termini Station at nine in the morning for a 3 day stay prior to our cruise and started hoofing it to the hotel with our suitcases. It is a pretty easy walk with no luggage, but I wouldn't recommend it with a heavy suitcase. The taxi ride back to the station only cost 7.50 euros, so well worth the money if you have luggage. The hotel booked us in but would only store our luggage and said we would have to come back at 2:00pm when the room would be ready. So after a long flight from Vancouver and a map in hand, we walked a couple of blocks to the Forum, and explored Rome for a few hours. The location of the hotel is amazing. We checked in at 2:00 and were pretty disappointed with the condition of the room - it was like something from a bad 70's motel. I haven't seen a door carpeted before - maybe it was a cheap way to insulate it from the noise in the hallways. We were on the 5th floor at the front of the hotel. The air conditioning wasn't working and the room was very stuffy, but really noisy if we opened the window. Breakfast was really good and plentiful. Ask for cappuccino or expresso from the server, they are happy to get you one. Having said all this the location of the hotel made up for any flaws. We felt the price was pretty expensive, for what you get. But I guess that's Rome for you, everything is expensive. You may have to pay a bit more and request one of the renovated rooms. It may be worth the extra. I also wish they had free wifi. I can't believe in this day and age you have to pay wifi in some hotels. We thoroughly enjoyed our stay in Rome, I don't think I have ever walked so much in three days. I hope we will return again to explore some more.

Reviews.Title: “Highly over priced”
Reviews.Author: journiman
Reviews.Content: Had a three day stop here with wife and 8 yr old daughter. Lovely area and good location but what a disappointment the hotel was. We paid over £600 for three nights and were given an old room in poor decoration, with wood hanging from the ceiling. The electrical unit made so much noise we had to have it turned off at night to sleep. Not that it helped, as the beds are like concrete. My wife had to revert to cushions on the floor! The room safe was not working so had to keep valuable with us all the time. Not a good idea in a city full of tourists and pickpockets. Breakfast was plentiful, but tables were not and we had to use place settings before they were cleared as not enough staff. This is a 4 star hotel, but sadly not 4 star service. I travel widely and I am not being fussy, this really is a poor standard. Hotel staff told us to complain to booking agent. Not impressed!

Reviews.Title: “Great location.”
Reviews.Author: eddiejules
Reviews.Content: First class hotel with a great location which is a must for Rome.Metres away from the Metro.Service and facilities cannot be faulted. DO NOT TAKE THE TERRAVISION BUS FROM THE TERMINI TO THE AIRPORT. Our bus was almost 30 mins late departing and crawled to the airport (passed twice by dust carts).Just managed to catch the second plane transfer bus having booked priority booking.Very stressfull !!!

Reviews.Title: “Try another hotel.”
Reviews.Author: Marieke17
Reviews.Content: Very out-dated rooms. Food on breakfast bar was pretty awful and the hotel front desk staff could not have been more rude. Will not stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “THIS HOTEL IS A FRAUD and SHADY STAFF AND CHARGES...AND BED BUGS....DO NOT STAY HERE..”
Reviews.Author: justsunn
Reviews.Content: Yes this hotel is close to my destinations but BEWARE OF hotel charges and its staff...when I checked in around 5PM, this check-in guy wanted to see my passport...WHO THE HELL CHECKS PASSPORTS? I just have come from PARIS AND and HOTEL their didnt check my passport...I understand, they might want to see an ID but the guy was like passport...I didnt argue I handed over the passport and since you have to pay for the WIFI, I got 24 hours for E25...and when I checked out, the guy was like E35 and when I questioned he was E10 for city taxes...who charges 50% taxes? SInce, I had only 2 1/2 hours to the airport, I didnt argue..PLUS THEY HAD BED BUGS even though, I was in the newer rooms on the 7th floor, and they DO NOT CHANGE THE LINENS unless you request it which I found out on my last stay as I noticed my sheets were not changed....and their breakfast is OK until I saw HAIR in the SALAD...too disgusting and all nearby shops like to RIP off Tourists...they charged me E7 for two bottles of water and 3 bananas.....I went to eat in Paris too and went to mini market but they charged me appropriately....these people are FRAUDS stay away from the HOTEL...AND THEIR WIFI DIDNT EVEN WORK PROPERLY

Reviews.Title: “Ideal location, clean rooms, nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: fr3houston
Reviews.Content: We were not expecting much out of this hotel when we first booked it, and the hotel really exceeded our expectations. The location was incredible - if you walk down the street of Cavour, you reach the Forum. If you look down any of the streets, it's less than a 5 minute walk to the Colliseum. It was also pretty close to the city center. The metro was literally around the corner which made getting to the Vatican much easier. The room was clean and spacious. Comfortable bed, nice bathroom. The only negative (very minor) was that the room only had two small windows near the ceiling, but they had power switches to open the blinds and the windows. Just no view or much ventilation, but this didn't bother us at all. Breakfast was great, lots of options. The service was all right - most of them were friendly enough, but if you're looking to depend on them in terms of concierge service, forget it. The internet was extremely expensive, which surprised us. We ended up paying for 12 hours (not continuous, 12 hours of usage total which helps) for about 20 euros. They do NOT have free internet in their business center, so you'd still have to pay for the service even if you use their computers.

Reviews.Title: “GREAT LOCATION AND BREAKFAST TO START YOUR DAY”
Reviews.Author: advisorview
Reviews.Content: I did thwe tour through Gate 1 travel and it was our first time in ROME. The first impression of the hotel is good. The staff is helpful and courteous. The rooms are small and the beds are light and can move easily. You might hear the voices in the hallway or next room. BUT THERE IS SUCH A PLUS with this Hotel regarding Location. You walk one large block to the Coliseum and three blocks down to the view the Roman Ruins, The Forum which you can do at your lesiure. The Trevi fountain with the church nearby is just amazing site and the spanish steps with the coture stores are another plus all close to the hotel . The stores that are managed by Orientals are NOT necessarily the best deals anymore. We had an Italian painter signing our purchased photos in sepia and watercolor. Then there are the merchants with knockoff items at good prices and genuine leather. We looked for items actually carrying made in Italy on the item. This hotel has a shower bath with a revolving type of glass curtain which can leak. So does the hotel in Paris. This was not my favorite but the water was hot when needed. We loved the breakfast offered the eggs, bacon which tastes like Canadian bacon, juices, cheeses, meats, and their Italian coffee was plentiful. There is a grocery store on the opposite side to the left when you exit the hotel and also to the left on the side of the hotel is a nice restaurant offering GIANT MUSSLES, Bufalo cheese with tomatoe which you can drizzle with olive oil for appetizer and the smoothest wine. With all the walking, we slept very well on the light matresses.There is a Phillips tv. There is a hair dryer. The staff helped with the internet. They are Italians and offer us their services and help to make our trip more enjoyable. We appreciated that. There is a book store at the end of the block where you may purchase Italian cookbooks in different languages. We both loved our stay here.The staff would call and confirm our transfers .

Reviews.Title: “AAA great location good rates”
Reviews.Author: VizziOne
Reviews.Content: I agree with the previous reviews.This place has a great breakfast,great location central to all sights and great places to eat. Only drawback is a lot of tours, with a lot of kids.Stayed in Rm 520 at end of hallway (first rm was smoking ask for a new room and the porter called the desk and they changed me right away)this rm was very good.I would stay here again,walk to everything.Ask for a room at the end of the hallway

Reviews.Title: “Perfect hotel for a weekend break”
Reviews.Author: dealdickie
Reviews.Content: Worked out perfectly for a weekend break. Big room comfortable beds - friendly staff - fantastic breakfast buffet. Best thing is location - the streets directly behind the hotel were choc full of great bars, restaurants, ice cream shops ect.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location to see Rome and connect to the rest of Italy”
Reviews.Author: Marco-Babs
Reviews.Content: The hotel is just around the corner from the colluseum and around the corner from the heart of Rome. The farthest we walked was to the Vatican and that took only 30 minutes. Everything else is within that range. Also, the train station is a short walk (10 min.) up on the same street. In the streets behind the hotel there is the subway and you have the local eats including fresh filled cannolis to order!!! Markets nearby for picking up waters, wine, etc. plus an ATM on the corner. The hotel is older but the lobby is impressive and the rooms are good. Staff were very helpful and friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Good Stay!”
Reviews.Author: Globetraveller1905
Reviews.Content: I recently returned from a lovely 6 day vacation at Rome with my parents. We stayed at a trip classic room at GHP and it was a pleasant stay. Room was comfortable :clean with good bathrooms, good breakfast and helpful staff! The WiFi was the only issue, we did not get any signal in our room. The location was fantastic , just 10min walk from the colosseum and 20-30 minus to the other spots. We loved our stay and would definitely recommend GHP! Just a small tip: It is better to book your tours online and not go with the green line tours promoted at the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel - really added to a fantastic holiday”
Reviews.Author: Jennyapple
Reviews.Content: We travelled to Rome for New Year and stayed 4 nights in this great hotel with our three children aged 3, 6 and 9. From start to finish there was nothing I could complain about. The lady who booked us in spoke perfect English and offered great advice, the front desk staff were always helpful and attendant and the rooms (we had booked 2 inter-connecting as travelling with young kids) were really lovely. I had heard that hotels in Rome were small and expensive but the rooms in this hotel were very nice, good size, recently done up and I got exactly what I asked for. I did choose the upgraded room at a higher price (again advice of the reservations staff) and it was definetely worth it. The restaurant is fabulous and is really no more expensive than other much lesser restaurants out in the city. Location of this hotel is perfect - around te corner from the Forum and down the street from the Collesseum. Plenty to see and do in walking distance and there is a metro staion closeby although we didnt use it. All round - a good choice. The only problem my kids came up with was that there was no English speaking films for them to watch in the evenings when they just wanted to wind down after a busy day.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay!”
Reviews.Author: buttonsgone
Reviews.Content: We traveled with Gate1 Travel on their Romantic Italy Amalfi tour...all the arrangements they made were terrific. The Hotel Palatino in Rome is one example. The location is great - within walking distance to lots of Rome's "attractions". We even walked back from Vatican City one evening on our own...took about 45 minutes. It was my husband's birthday while we were there and there is a great bakery 1/2 block away that our tour manager, Nicoletta, recommended. I purchased a delightful cake there, took it back to the hotel and the hotel staff gave us plates, forks, napkins - all we needed to have a celebration in our room. We would definitely recommend this tour, Gate 1 and this hotel to any interested in a terrific trip to Italy!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location!”
Reviews.Author: seetheworld02
Reviews.Content: This hotel was in a great spot! It was within walking distance of the Forum (maybe 10 minutes) and a two minute walk to the subway. There are also two amazing churches within walking distance. The room was nice - no complaints. The breakfast was runny scrambled eggs, bacon, bread, pastries, fruit, cheses and meats. We ate dinner here the first night - we were exhausted when we arrived. This was the best meal that we had! The gnocchi with buffalo mozzarilla and tomato was amazing!!! Ask for a bottle of the house wine. It is wonderful and very inexpensive. The staff were very nice. We arrived before our room was not ready. By the time we had used the restroom and freshened up, our room was ready. We have no complaints regarding our stay.

Reviews.Title: “Nice view”
Reviews.Author: Chindemi
Reviews.Content: Big rooms with nice view of Rome (we stayed on 7th floor). Near the forum and colesseum. Nice restaurant and complete breakfast. A bit expensive.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: Ronin28
Reviews.Content: Hotel is centrally located, close to major attractions in Rome. Stayed part of a group tour for 2 nights. Rooms are large for European standards. Large reception area. Caters mostly to big tour groups, so might tend to be rather noisy at times. Food in the dinning room o.k. nothing special.

Reviews.Title: “NOTHING SPECIAL”
Reviews.Author: Zimmermann068
Reviews.Content: I stayed in Rome with some friends of mine. The position of the hotel is great:right in the town center, just a few steps from the Coliseum. Rooms need a refreshing and breakfast has to be improved. Reception should be more friendly and attentive.

Reviews.Title: “Loved Rome.. liked the hotel”
Reviews.Author: halwaya
Reviews.Content: The Grand Hotel Palatino has a great location, just few minutes away from the Colosseum. By the hotel there is a 'City Sightseeing' bus stop, so a perfect start for your exploring Rome adventure. The hotel staff can arrange the tickets for you, but still you can do it yourself directly from the bus pilot ;) Front desk staff was very helpful and had a sence of humour, We enjoyed the experience of checking-in and checking out. We have booked the old-style double room and I must admit I would recognise why it was called 'old style', but it was clean and the bed was comfortable, so for me that's not a problem.. as I spent most of the time away.. In the night you could hear the traffic.. anyway I was that tired every day that it didn't bother me at all. The bathroom was also old style, but also very clean.. the only thing I didn't like was the sound of the toilet flush.. quite loud, so I hope we didn't irritate our 'neighbours'. The breakfast was a nice experience too. Palatino has two breakfast rooms. One is for the large groups and the other is for the individually booked guests. As we were the individuals we loved it. The waitresses were not always smiling, but again I know how I act sometimes at work when dealing with the customers, so I fully understand :) Outside the hotel there are nice restaurants, pubs, internet cafe, grocery shop, so pretty much everything what you need. Overall I must say I liked the hotel and probably I would choose it again.. because something tells me I will go back to Rome again. I loved the city.

Reviews.Title: “Avoid this hotel, extremely dated rooms, rude staff!”
Reviews.Author: trixie1948
Reviews.Content: The rooms in this hotel have not been updated since the 80's. This is not a 4 star - more like a "barely" 3 star hotel. The carpet was old and dirty and the beds were hard and uncomfortable. The front desk staff was all extremely rude and very unhelpful. The location is great, but there are many hotels in Rome with great locations. We stayed at another hotel for 2 nights in Rome before moving to the Palatino. It was close to the Vatican and it was wonderful! The cost was about $10 more but worth it. I would not recommend the Palatino Grand Hotel for anyone. Additionally, friends we were traveling with found bed bugs in their room. I know this is a world wide problem, but no one wants to be in a hotel with bed bugs.

Reviews.Title: “The Palatino Hotel”
Reviews.Author: charlotte08
Reviews.Content: My husband and I have stayed in this hotel several times and each time has been a good experience. It is very clean, close to everything, walking distance to all the wonderful places that we enjoy going to, good restaurants nearby,, good gelato on the corner (best in Rome), good shopping, and an excellent breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location. Our hotel for Roma!”
Reviews.Author: Carroll177
Reviews.Content: We searched hotels on the Internet and this one captured us because of the location and the fact that they had a category of rooms, Executive Rooms, top floor with balconies. So, sight unseen, we booked and prepaid for three nights. We arrived in the morning from a cruise ship and our room was ready. We opened the door to our room and were delighted! The room was plenty large with a queen bed, hardwood floors, flatscreen tv, and the bathroom was huge with an emormous tub/shower. But the balcony overlooking the rooftops of Rome was the best with a small round table and two chairs -- plus total privacy. The Forum and Colosseum are just 3-4 blocks away. We walked from our hotel everywhere to see the sights. Breakfast was included and it was average, but very nice with scrambled eggs, bacon, breads, pastries, fruit, cheese, etc., etc. We certainly have no complaints. If, no when we return to Roma, this will be our hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Centrally located near to Forum and better than most”
Reviews.Author: tvjk
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for week in August and found the hotel a good choice. Stayed in a modernised room on the 7th floor and found the extra cost worth the money as the standard was higher than the other hotels in Rome I have stayed in. Buffet breakfast was fine with a mixture of hot and cold dishes. Limited drawer space in the room but not a major problem. I found no problems with the desk staff unlike other reviews. The hotel is very close to the Cavour metro station which is very handy and not at all noisy. There are also stops on 117 mini bus just around the corner and the open top tourist buses stop outside the hotel as St Peter in Chains Basilica is up the steps opposite. One thing to note is that the lower part of Via Cavour i.e. Outside the hotel is closed to traffic on Sundays as the Forum is a pedestrian zone so the buses don't run past the hotel -use the metro if travelling from Termini.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and reasonably priced”
Reviews.Author: Koku
Reviews.Content: The location is great - just a few blocks from the Colosseum and Forum. We were able to get a really decent rate after keeping an eye on their summer specials. I've stayed there before as part of a tour group - which this hotel does seem to cater to. Roberto at the desk was very helpful in recommending local restaurants that were excellent. Our favorite was Ceito (I'm probably spelling it wrong). Homemade pasta and excellent waitstaff. Loved it so much we went twice.

Reviews.Title: “Rude and unaccomodating for family with kids”
Reviews.Author: kylescott
Reviews.Content: We booked a room for July of this year. When we arrived from the airport we were told that our family of four, husband, wife and two kids (12 & 14) could not stay in the triple room that we had booked. We were told that we would have to pay for two rooms, which would not even be adjoining. When we told the hotel staff that we did not want to pay for two rooms and would find another hotel to stay at, they told us that they would still charge us for the triple room that they would not let us stay in. I told them if they did, then I would go on tripadvisor and write a bad review. They did not care and charged my credit card, which I am disputing. So I am keeping my word and letting potential guests know that this is a terrible choice for families traveling in Rome. I would not recommend this hotel EVER!!! Also, Via Cavour is a main street and it is very noisy.

Reviews.Title: “Good choice for tourist travel”
Reviews.Author: TX_Vic
Reviews.Content: We stayed in Rome for a week and enjoyed our stay at Grand Hotel Palatino. There were good and not so good things but I'd likely stay there again. At check-in we were shown a 2nd floor room facing the street. I said no way, we need another room. Only room we could get was an upgrade. We paid an extra 30 Euros a nite and were put on 7th floor facing rear of of hotel. OK the air conditioning thing. It was on the warm side in Rome during our stay. I was told by the front desk they do not turn on the AC until June. We got this story everywhere in Italy, except Florence and Cinque Terre. So this was a problem for us. Couldn't keep the windows open at night because the noise coming up from tavern on the street below. It was way to warm. Breakfast was very good. Eggs, sausages, fruit, cereal, breads, meats and cheeses. The room was a decent size by Italian standards but small by USA norms. Bathroom was clean, the bed was firm but comfortable. Housekeeping did an excellent job each day. Absolutely no bug problems as stated in another review. Staff was efficient and helpful but not overly friendly. The location might be it's best feature. For the price I would expect air conditioning next time or I might be tempted to find another place.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel!”
Reviews.Author: kansastraveler42
Reviews.Content: I read a previous review and just had to comment - this hotel DOES have air conditioning! The location is great - a few minutes walk to the Colosseum and other sites. Also close to cute shops and cafes. I was with a high school trip of 27 people and the service and accommodations were quite nice!

Reviews.Title: “BED BUGS!!!”
Reviews.Author: andypro
Reviews.Content: My wife was covered in bed bugs after staying at this hotel. I only hope that we did not bring them home with us. We were on a great tour with a great guide but this sure will put a cloud over our great memories. She is now on prednisone and we are hoping that we do not have to treat our entire house.

Reviews.Title: “Roman Holiday”
Reviews.Author: Day12
Reviews.Content: Rome was wonderful! The Hotel is located central, a short walk to the Roman Forum, and many attractions in the area. Can't complain the hotel staff was pretty friendly. The Continental Breakfast was good. Although, I think the eggs were a little funny. But overall a nice hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Good location and helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: PJKJoplin
Reviews.Content: We found this hotel to be totally acceptable. I was a little nervous considering some of the reviews. The location is excellent. The rooms were average size for a European hotel in a large city. The breakfast was not outstanding but certainly fine. A huge tour group invaded the hotel our last night, so the breakfast room on the last morning we were there was packed. On our trip to the hotel, I was separated from my spouse and friends at the train station. Long story, but the hotel staff was very kind and helpful as my husband and I tried to find each other. One person actually loaned my husband her own cell so that he could call back in to see if I had made contact.

Reviews.Title: “The bus tours love it”
Reviews.Author: Roger123
Reviews.Content: I was here for 10 days during May 2010. I booked it since it was walking distance to my meetings but I was initially a bit worried due to some poor reviews on this site. As far as I can tell, those who complained must not be used to anything other than the Four Seasons since my experience was overall quite pleasant and uneventful, especially given the average price of about 150 Euros a night. Okay maybe the noise from the hallways was a bit much and I think if your room faced the street and not the back, it could be a bit loud but hey, this is Rome. The location and the staff are great and the rooms are huge for Europe but this is not a charming old world hotel. It's a large modern(ish) hotel that big American bus tours seem to love. In fact, it seemed that very few guests were not a part of such a group. The location is brilliant, about a 2 min walk to Cavour metro and about 15 min walk to the main station. In the other direction, the Colosseo is a short walk away. Behind the hotel and down the hill are some great little restos that are not touristic at all and offered good meals. Across the street and to the left is a decent sized supermarket which was a nice convenience. Overall this hotel is just fine but may not be what certain people are expecting in Rome.

Reviews.Title: “OVERPRICED DEFINETELY NOT A 4STAR HOTEL”
Reviews.Author: mimikapan
Reviews.Content: We paid 166 euro per night for this 4 star hotel. We stayed at the new style double bedroom, Room was not very clean (you could see the dust in many corners), the bathroom was nice, the beds were rather stiff and none of us enjoyed sleeping (we were two couples), breakfast was good nothing fancy (typical scrambled/boiled eggs, bacon, marmelades, bread, cheese, salami, canned fruit, cereal). The service was rather good (we were lucky as a greek girl was working at the hotel so we could communicate much better). Overall I would not recommend the hotel due to the price which by no means corresponds to the 4star it says it is. Location is not bad (e.g. about 25 mins quick walk to fontana di trevi, very close to the colosseum) mimika-dimos/elena-giorgos

Reviews.Title: “With everything one needs around...”
Reviews.Author: KristynaK
Reviews.Content: This hotel was in the middle of it all. The Colloseum was only 5 minutes walk, so you can have a walk there any time of the day, it looks especially glamorous at night. Metro is literally few metres away, because next to the hotel are stairs leading almost to the actual metro station, the is loads of lovely little ristorantes and trattorias around that area that we didn't even manage to try a quater of them during our stay and for a caffee and a dessert in the afternoon I recommend sweet little caffeteria which is opposite the stairs leading towards metro. Room was good enough, very comfortable and clean, only downsite was the bathroom which wasn't quite as nice (it was definitely clean though), because it was small and the toilet was hiding behind the door and also quite noisy (i.e. when flushing). Internet is paid! Very annoying it's very expensive - 5€ / 30 minutes, 8€ / hour, 25€ / day. I took my laptop with me to check to sights on the internet, but wasn't willing to pay that riddiculous sum, so didn't use it at all. Staff at the reception is very helpfull, they give you a printed map of centre of Rome and you can pretty much get by with it, if wanting to see the main things. They even told us what the main things to see are depending on how long we stay. Breakfast is lovely, wide selection of stuff - you get some fruit, veg, bread, lovely prosciutto ham, eggs, croissants...

Reviews.Title: “Customer Service + Central Location + Accommodations = Grand Hotel Palatino!”
Reviews.Author: mrs-metropolitan
Reviews.Content: We HIGHLY recommend The Grand Hotel Palatino! We have stayed here twice in the last two years. Here's why.... - Location is very central and within walking distance to many attractions/tourist sites and one block to the metro if necessary. - Accommodations are clean and spacious. (Larger than average European size room.) - Staff is extremely professional, friendly, and helpful. Also, there is always someone who speaks English on duty at the front desk. The hotel has gone through renovations and we have stayed in both their non-renovated and renovated room. Both styles are comfortable and clean. If you are doing price comparison to other hotels in Rome, you may find their rate may be a bit higher than others. However, it’s worth the few extra Euros (trust us)! We have stayed at other hotels in Rome and The Grand Hotel Palatino receives our highest remarks and exceeds all expectations with customer service! We look forward to our next trip to Rome and plan on staying at Grand Hotel Palatino.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: MrTin
Reviews.Content: The room we stayed in was quite old and the air con was broken. The breakfast was a little bit poor but ok. We stayed here for two nights and the location was perfect for exploring Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Mohair Walls !?!”
Reviews.Author: luvswine2
Reviews.Content: This hotel was recommended by our travel company. Disgusting ! Room actually had furry walls with 60's style furniture, roll out beds, filthy carpet and walls, could hear everything neighbors said and did as well as noise from the street, awful food, surly rude desk clerk, tiny bathroom ! We didn't have enough room to lay out our luggage in the room because the room was so small. We had 3 pieces of luggage, not a lot. Had the front desk call for a reputable taxi when leaving, taxi driver abused us with a 120 plus miles an hour detour through junk yards and scary roads to the airport. Yes we were three women and I think he did this to intimidate us.Then over charged us when we got to the airport. Thanks for sending us a reputable taxi. Horrible place avoid it !

Reviews.Title: “I would definately go back to the Palatino”
Reviews.Author: Toots14
Reviews.Content: The room and en suite bathroom was very clean and spacious with bright modern furnishings. It had a comfortable sitting area and there was plenty space for clothes, shoes etc. It was in a really good location close many of the sights. About 10 minutes from the colosseum and very near the Metro. I would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “sounds grand but not the case”
Reviews.Author: millieamersham
Reviews.Content: As a surprise, i bought a four day trip to rome for my partners 40th birthday. On arrival I found the reception staff to be rude and very unhelpful. The reception arear was very dated but to be fair clean. On arrival to our toom the wall safe had been jemmied open, and again, very basic for an alleged four star hotel. We made the complaint about our safe and we were provided with a key, but it was clearly not secure. In the morning of the next day, proceeded to go and shower, no hot water or cold was available, an immediate complaint was made, to no avail stating building work was in progress, the water remained off for four hours until 1400 hours. This continued for the whole stay. This totally ruined our stay, and despite numerous complaints were sneered at by staff. No iron was provided in the room, stating it was against fire regulations, however for a samll fee of 12 euros they offered to iron a shirt. All in all this hotel would struggle to get 2 stars in the UK. A definite No from us

Reviews.Title: “Amazing”
Reviews.Author: Emilywhite
Reviews.Content: This is a very well kept hotel and the rooms/balconies are astonishing.

Reviews.Title: “Ok..more of a college aged tour hotel”
Reviews.Author: TechnoPimp
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for a total of 4 nights. The first 3 nights were ok. The rooms are slightly small but ok. The staff was always very nice and helpful and its in a decent location for Coliseum , Train station and Shopping areas. However, this is a 3 star type hotel and we did have issues with loud drunken neighbors on our last night there. Hotel staff was pretty much useless with this issue. All in in all our stay was decent but I would not stay there again. The break fast was passable but just passable. The Hotel is a bit older so it does have a bit of a worn look about it but reasonably clean. Bottom-line its just not a family vacation hotel more of a college-aged tour bus type of place.

Reviews.Title: “bed bugs!”
Reviews.Author: travellover421
Reviews.Content: Please stay away. Between my roommate and I, we got 50 bites!

Reviews.Title: “Stay away...”
Reviews.Author: HermosaB
Reviews.Content: we spent the holidays in this hotel. Location was great, I must say,but the hotel staff was no friendly at all. I broke my leg while in Italy so I was in an wheelchair for most of the time while in Rome. The staff were rude and not helpful. Our room was on the old part of the hotel, was dirty, all the plugs were not working. We woke up every day at 7am because of the remodelations right on the top floor! I don't know how other people in the reviews said got slippers and robes, we verily got clean towels, the bathroom was not very clean. Ladies, take your own hair dryer, the one in the hotel is very old and it took me long time to dry my hair. Breakfast was until 10am, mediocre but ok. Do not drink from the coffee pots provide at the table, its horrible, taste like instant coffee. Order with the waitress, if you are lucky you will be able to drink your cappuccino 1 hour after ordered. We usually got there around 8 or 9am and waited 20 minutes for a table most of the time. We wanted to move from this chaotic hotel, but due to the holidays all the hotels were booked up. Rome during the holidays was pretty busy everywhere, the advantage of being in a wheelchair was most of time we didn't have to wait on line for museums or Sistine Chapel but people were rude and got lots of discriminatory looks on the streets.( My cast was not visible, because the cold was wearing a black sock.) Overall, Rome is a beautiful city, stay away from Palatine Hotel, don't get fool for the 4 stars.

Reviews.Title: “The quality of the room was a suprise”
Reviews.Author: LouisianaTravelor
Reviews.Content: This hotel is located just 1/2 block from the subway. My room on the top floor was very nice, recently updated with the now common flat screen tv, very nice bath, small frig. and nice bedding. Just across the street is "ELITE" a nice size grocery store with excellent prepared food. Just behind the hotel and down a set of stairs is a street with several small nice restaurants, a lively bar and a pizza restaurant cooking with a wood fire.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic”
Reviews.Author: Suzy7837
Reviews.Content: Great hotel in a perfect location in a pleasant neighborhood with nice restaurants near the Colisseum, Forum and other monuments. Convenient to local transportation. Staff was very pleasant and helpful. Lovely ambiance and even received a complimentary upgrade from standard double room to 2 room suite, as it was our honeymoon. We will never stay anywhere else in Rome on future trips!

Reviews.Title: “Clean and good location”
Reviews.Author: ABGSC
Reviews.Content: We got one of the executive rooms with a balcony overlooking Via Cavour with a view of some of the Forum in the distance. With the exchange rate being as it is, this hotel was expensive, especially compared to what you get in the states for a similar price, however I can't say it was out of line with prices for comparable hotels nearby. The breakfast was very good, just make sure they seat you in the smaller dining room as there was more to offer in there. The location was definitely central to all of Rome's most popular attractions. Also, just as a note, internet was five euro for thrity minutes.

Reviews.Title: “Nice place, good location, if you get one of the new rooms”
Reviews.Author: Cueball123
Reviews.Content: We had a great stay for 3 nights at the Palatino. The staff was great. Breakfast was good enough. Location was super (2 blocks from Coliseum.) Our friends had some of the older rooms and were quite dissapointed. We had some of newer suites which were huge, brand new and stylish! Overall it's a good value and good choice.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect!”
Reviews.Author: scubalaura05
Reviews.Content: We booked the Grand Palatino Hotel after a great recommendation from a family friend. The hotel lived up to all of the wonderful things we had heard. The location is great- literally 3 minutes from the Colosseum and 10-15 minutes walk from Trevi Fountain or Termini Station. It is also just down the street from the Cavour metro stop. Our room was right in front of the elevator which always makes me nervous and we were on the front street-side, but I never once woke up from either noise. The hotel has double-pain windows which kept our room quiet and cool with the powerful AC. Breakfast was good, but be sure to beat the tour groups. One morning we slept in (around 9am) and the smaller dining room was full so we ate in the tour group room. There was less to choose from, it was very picked over and the service was sparse. We learned our lesson and never had that problem again. We had a great stay and would definitely recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Falcaldo in July”
Reviews.Author: borge
Reviews.Content: Rome in the summer is hotter than Hades, but nonetheless the swamp a$$ is worth it. My wife and I traveled via back pack from Finland to Itlay, hiking through the Swiss Alps and into France before we finally settled in the beautiful, but dirty city of Rome. The Palatino Grand Hotel was situated near the Colloseum and overall was a well positioned hotel in the city. Easily within walking distances to every major sight (except the Vatican) 5 minutes! As most Italians told us the time it took to get anywhere. Good luck finding the Trevi Fountain and the stupid Spanish Steps, we walked around the same spot several times, before we stumbled upon the beautiful, yet jam packed fountain. The Italian people in Rome were pretty rude to say the least, but that's because they mistook me for an Italian and thought of me as a "sell out" because I am not fluent in Italian, to their and my mother's dismay I am not Italian, just darker than your average Norweigan. Be prepared to bump into people often, because Rome is packed with people, learn the word "scuzi" and the hand gesture that resembles a "fyou" in America, you will need both Italian staplemates. The hotel was standard at best, it had air conditioning, the rooms were clean and the bathroom had a very sensual toy for couples only, it was amazing, cold water flowing in your nether regions, sensational idea those Italians have. The breakfast was offered as a buffet, my god was it not an American style breakfast, I ate popovers with jam and canned peaches everyday, I didn't want to touch the eggs, or the sausage that looked as if they were still clucking and snorting around on plates, at least it had bottle water. Speaking of water, the public water in Rome is actually good to drink, I drank from the Spanish Steps and at the Roman Forum, the Roman Forum was very refreshing, especially the one at the top of the hill overlooking the entire city, make sure you push your way through to the water to get a sip, because Europeans have never heard of waiting in a line like normal, civilized people, which is hard for me to say since I am European at heart. You must find IL Maggio Ristorante near the Trevi Fountain, it serves up the greatest Pollo Romano that I have ever had! We spent some serious Euro here, but well worth it, ask for Gino and you'll get free bread. A few helpful hints while traveling in Rome: do as Romans do and walk out in front of traffic at anytime, but be leary of mopeds and motorcycles. Don't take pictures with guys dressed in gladiator suits, they will charge you 5 euro per picture, or smack you around a little if you don't pay. Refuse the bread at dinner, because they will make you pay for it even if you don't ask for it. Ask the restaurant if they take credit card first before you start ordering, sometimes they don't take credit card unless it's over 40 Euro, and last but certainly not least, don't exchange your cash and use your debit card at the ATM, or credit card as much as possible, you will get a much better rate.
