Overall the hotel wasn't very nice looking, it didn't have any real character and was not what I would have expected in Rome, however it was safe and clean and was in a decent area for sightseeing.

Reviews.Title: “fantastic location and great breakfast!!”
Reviews.Author: smile220
Reviews.Content: The hotel location was fantastic. 3 minutes from the Colosseum and 10 to the Trevi Fountain. You couldn't ask for a better spot. The staff was helpful and the service great. The breakfast was wonderful as was the capuccinos. We had the new modern rooms and they were beautiful. The rooms were soundproof and you could not hear any outside noise even on this busy street. I would definetly stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great location!”
Reviews.Author: Fabrizio80
Reviews.Content: I loved the location of this hotel, it's a five minute walk to the coloseum and very close to good restaurants. Breakfast was good, they had a lot of things to choose from, the only bad thing is that they had stuff all over the place during breakfast so it was a little confusing. Staff could be a little friendlier, but they provided accurate answers to our questions. The room was really nice and we had a very nice wiew. I would reccomend this place

Reviews.Title: “LOCATION, LOCATION, LOCATION”
Reviews.Author: pimptown
Reviews.Content: This was a very nice hotel maybe because we had a room with a view of the city and the room was equiped with a terrace. The terrace was well lit at night ...bring bug spray....and provided a table and chairs. The bathroom and the actual room was new with mosaic tiles, marble and art work were a blessing. Robert, at the front desk was so so very helpful on things to do and places to go in the area. In fact, he went way out of his way to accomadate our ventures. Please remember it is a lot easier to exchange your money at the hotels...and this hotel was no exception. On the 8th floor we experienced turndown service every night with a well equipped coffie maker, robe and slippers...you can keep the slippers too!!!! The location was near the train station, fourm, colosseum, internet cafe and resturants. Additionally, all of the hop on hop off buses that gave a great tour of the city could be found right around the corner from the hotel. Additionally, the hotel provides a private shuttle service to the airport which was great for 50 E. Two blocks away are roman remains of the eternal city to explore and enjoy.

Reviews.Title: “You must get an executive room on the 8th floor!”
Reviews.Author: mymywhatadump
Reviews.Content: This hotel has a lot of tours staying with them. They are on the lower floors. I didn't see those rooms, but I saw the hallways. If you want really nice rooms you must make a reservation for an executive room. These rooms are on the 8th floor. We had the simplest (no lounge and not a suite) room. Our room had a small private terrace. The beds are hard, but it seems Italy is filled with hard beds. I loved the bathroom. They had the best shower in Italy. We had controls for the airconditioning and our rooms were cool. The breakfast was okay, you just had to search a little bit. They need to cook their eggs longer. They cook the bacon so one side is crispy and the other side isn't. Just eat the top half. Loved the hams, fruit and bread. The subway is very close. Make a left and walk about thirty seconds. There are a lot of really good restaurants that are cheap. To get to the best gelato place: Make a right out of the building and walk to the corner of the block. Make a right and walk up the street. The place is on the left side of the street. If you need to buy water (it was very hot) the best place is to the right of the hotel. It is one of the tacky little stores before the corner. A bottle of water was 80 cents instead of the 2 to 3 Euros at other places. Very close to several ruins and walking distant other sites.

Reviews.Title: “Very Pleasant Stay”
Reviews.Author: WangwangLuxembourg
Reviews.Content: Great location, clean rooms, and thoughtful staff. I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Big disappointment”
Reviews.Author: jla1113
Reviews.Content: After looking on line at MANY hotels in Rome, I decided on the Palatino. It looked lovely and the location was perfect. Unfortunately, as I have learned on other occasions, sometimes photos don't tell the whole story, or a business can be very selective with what they photograph. Our room looked like it had not been updated in atleast 40 years. The AC did not work, so we slept with the door propped open because the one in the hallway was right by our room...it was cranking out the cool air. The bathroom had mildew in the tile of the shower/tub area and around the window...it was also dirty along the window. The vanity area was very small and the hairdryer was ancient. Not to mention there were no plugs where I could use my own hairdryer. I found our extra clean towels laying on the bidet. We requested a cot when reserving online. When we arrived in our room there was no cot and we ask 3 more times, once just after check in, once at 11 pm and again the next morning...we never got the extra cot. Luckily our child was under 6 and we weren't charged for it. However, it was a bit cramped having a 6 year old and almost 4 year old share a twin bed. The breakfast that was included in the cost was not bad. Living in Europe, I have had way better and I've had some that were worse. However, the service was not the best. Once day the waitress was very attentive with our young boys and the next day we could hardly get a cup of coffee. Also, the front desk service was not exceptional. Seemed like we were interupting them when we ask a question. There was one gentlman, unfortunately I did not get his name who was VERY nice and gave us some excellent tips and directions for getting to the Vatican. The redeeming quality for this hotel was it's proximity to the Colosseum and other sites. With young children we were able to walk to many sites and had little complaint from them.

Reviews.Title: “Nice location, poor service, dishonest”
Reviews.Author: haplo888
Reviews.Content: When we arrived for our 8 night honeymoon stay, their garage was flooded and they offered to leave our car in a reserved area in front of the hotel. We left our keys with them in case they needed to move it. At 8am I went down to move the car to the garage and found that they had illegally parked the car down the street and I had a huge ticket. After much agruement they finally agreed to pay the fine, but a few months later my rental company had charged my credit card for the unpaid fine. Worse, we had called in advance to check out parking arrangements and were quoted a price for parking. We confirmed this price when we parked the car. However, upon checking out they demanded some 150 euros more than the quoted price. The demanded price was much more than the rates the garage had posted on their wall. The hotel refused to help now saying that the attached Palatino garage had nothing to do with the Palatino hotel. Luckily, the car was blocking all their incoming and outgoing traffic, and I had already gotten the keys. We negotiated an agreement about in the middle of the promised and the demanded prices. Ridiculous.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location to Metro & Collisum”
Reviews.Author: AlbertaMickey
Reviews.Content: We were with a tour company at this hotel, and understand why. The rooms are a standard size for Europe, were clean, and the shower actually worked well. The area felt safe, the front desk was most helpful, and english is universal. Beside the hotel are stairs that take you to a narrow road behind the hotel with a fabulous restaurant called the Cricket and the Ant - english version, and next door a most delicious ice cream store. Half a block away is the metro to anywhere in Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel Choice in Rome”
Reviews.Author: swisschar
Reviews.Content: We spent one night at the Palatino Grand Hotel before boarding a cruise ship the following day. The staff was very friendly and upon arrival the front desk advised us that they had upgraded us to an executive suite (we booked a superior room). The suite was very spacious with a beautiful bathroom and a private balcony. A piano bar was next to the lobby where we enjoyed an evening drink and some great music. A very nice breakfast was included. This hotel was a great find for us.

Reviews.Title: “Great location...that's it. Bad value i think”
Reviews.Author: pathkid
Reviews.Content: Pros: location great!, clean rooms, large hotel with all amenities, speak english Cons: pricey, broken AC, wont help you out, bad breakfast (for USA folk) This was the 3rd and final hotel on our Gate 1 Affordable Italy Tour. It was basically the worst one. The location is great! about 200 ft to the Cavour Subway line from which it's like 5 to 10 minutes to Spanish steps etc. The coloseum is like one street away 500ft. So, what was bad about it? Again, it's personal i suppose, but here it goes. Our AC was broken, and they wouldnt move us to another room.."excuse is no space" ALot of our tour group folks had broken AC, so I think it's a common complaint, but they dont seem to care, maybe cuz we already paid as part of tour package. Breakfast was again bad, cold stale bread, bad runny eggs, cheese/cold cuts ok, ok yogurt, and ok coffee/espresso (from a serve urself machine). I realized why European bbacon is so bad. It's unsmoked and super thick. It's like eating pan fried hand sliced fatback, which I think Europeans like. I like USA style that is smoked and crispy thin. Hotel was basically packed with tour groups. They do speak english and seem a little helpful with tour questions, but they won't cater to your complaints at all, cuz they got 100's more coming after you who already paid as well. So, no I wouldnt come back to this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Mediocre Hotel in a Great Location”
Reviews.Author: NormSouthJersey
Reviews.Content: After staying in very nice hotels in both Venice & Florence we were disappointed in the Palatino. Dirty carpets, room needed painting, very poor TV reception and very mixed service. Comfortable beds and a clean bath. We found one concierege who was great but others who literally could not be bothered. Breakfast was included every day but was poor. The location, however, was excellent. A block from the colossium, a block from a subway stop, maybe 3 blocks to the Forum, accross the street from St. Peter in Chains, etc. Included as a part of our tour, I would NEVER pay full freight for this place.

Reviews.Title: “great location - average hotel”
Reviews.Author: dotress
Reviews.Content: This hotel is adequate for travellers. In no universe should it ever be classed as 4 star though. At the recommendation of others we requested a top floor room as I understand these have been rennovated. Instead we got a 5th floor room. Room was standard and clean. No tea and coffee facilities. What was ridiculous was no iron in the room, no ironing room and no facility to bring you an iron as 'the wiring in the room is too old and it will blow up if you plug in' (reassuring as there is a TV plugged in...). What they will do is iron your clothes for you at a cost of 9 euro an item. Front desk ok - not great service on the evenings, better in the mornings The location is great though - really close to the Colloseum (5 min walk) which meant we could get there before the crowds. Beware of taxis ordered here though as one clearly had his meter tampered with and charged us a fortune - the meter ticked over at 3 times the normal speed

Reviews.Title: “poor service and dirty carpets”
Reviews.Author: JG-10
Reviews.Content: The best thing to be said about this hotel is its location, literally around the corner from the Colosseum, and one block to the train station, also plenty of bus stops nearby. However, the concierge staff was completely indifferent to us, not sure if it was because we are Americans, but most of the staff seemed bothered by us, no matter what our question was - and I even speak some Italian! When we arrived, they didn't offer to take our bags up to our room for us, we did it ourselves in the small elevator. The only two staff members that were friendly and helpful were Ornella and Roberto, everyone else was useless. We asked one guy to recommend a nearby restaurant for us, and he just shrugged and pretty much told us to walk around and find one on our own. NICE SERVICE, PALATINO!! YOU CAN'T THRIVE ON LOCATION ALONE! The carpet in our room was stained and dirty, and remained that way our entire stay. The breakfast staff (what there was of it) seemed grumpy and bothered, not one smiling face in the whole bunch. I would NOT recommend this hotel to anyone, there are other hotels in the vicinity, I will research those next time we go to Rome, we will NOT be returning to this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Customer service is non-existent, rooms vary depending upon type”
Reviews.Author: RideStrong
Reviews.Content: I had the occassion to stay at the Grand Palatino on 2 different occassions in May. I spend 6 months out of the year staying in hotels so I have a good base to judge. The customer service at the front desk was non-existent. There is no warm italian hospitality but rather a front desk staff with a serious attitude problem. They appeared very bothered if you asked them a question and even fought with me about several small items. I booked 2 different room types and they are vastly different. The executive rooms are on the top floor and they are very nice with turn down service, bathrobes and chocolates on your pillow. There is still car noise from the street but not too bad given the quality of the room. The standard rooms don't look so good and the new style rooms are nice but some are on the first floor literally on the street (no turn down service, no bathrobes) but the double paned windows are nice. As much as I liked the executive level rooms I don't think it's worth it given how unaccomodating the staff are. OH, beware, 8 euro for wireless internet access! Yikes.

Reviews.Title: “Near the Coloseum”
Reviews.Author: 5Kimba5
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel for 3 nights in April, 2009. Within walking distance to St. Peters in Chains church, Coloseum, Forum & Capital building. Had dinner one night at the hotel - very good pork roast. Had a room on the street side of the hotel. Since it was only April, the air conditioning was not yet turned on and it was quite warm, so we opened our windows to cool the room off. The street below was VERY noisy with the window open. Small refrigerator in the room. Comfortable beds, plenty of pillows & towels. No ice machine, so you had to get a small bucket of ice from the bar below. Be sure to insert your room key into the small box on the wall when you walk in - this ensures that the electricity will operate in the room. Would recommend da Robertino's restaurant within walking distance to the hotel - they did not have an English menu at the time, but the waitress spoke English and was very helpful with our selections - try the Roman artichokes! We sat outside in a semi enclosed area which was very pleasant and all of the ladies receive a rose at the end of dinner. Be sure to go up on the roof at sunset, you can get a nice view of the capitol building.

Reviews.Title: “great location”
Reviews.Author: hedgehog831
Reviews.Content: Nice hotel with a great location in Rome---walking distance to metro, Colosseum and Forum. Breakfast nothing special but had lots of options. Do not eat at the restaurant next door; overpriced with mediocre food. There was an excellent family run restaurant on the street behind the hotel, just adjacent to the metro entrance with reasonable prices. The house wine was delicious and only 1 euro! I would definately stay here again if I return to Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Location, Location, Location - and a very nice hotel too!”
Reviews.Author: Missionlady03
Reviews.Content: My husband and I decided to plan a trip to Rome and do it "on our on". We didn't want to be locked into a tour group so I researched hotels on Trip Advisor and in the Frommer Day by Day books. I discovered this hotel on the trip advisor website. I knew I wanted something that was close to the Colosseum because that was one of the main attractions that I wanted to see. This hotel is a five minute walk to the Colosseum and is in a great overall location. We walked to pretty much everything from here except the Vatican but we did end up walking back From the Vatican. Believe me we walked the entire city except the area near the Spanish Steps as the last 2 days of our trip were to be spent there at a different hotel. The hotel itself was quite nice. I had booked a stand room with a double bed on the hotel website but I had put in a special request for a complimentary upgrade if possible because we were celebrating our 20 year anniversary. The hotel arranged our transport from the airport to the hotel. When we arrived our room was not ready but after waiting maybe 15 minutes the desk clerk said he was upgrading us to a Junior Suite. This was really nice. It had an amazing bathroom and the room itself was quite large with a king size bed, table and chairs, lounging sofa, tv, safe. Our room came with a breakfast daily. They had two breakfast areas. One was for tour bus patons and the other was for people who had booked on their own. The food was actually quite good and there were many selections. There were the typical deli type meats and cheeses, scrambled eggs, bacon (that was a little too limp for my taste) numerous pastries, yogurt, juices, coffee. The staff in the breakfast area were a little snobby some days but we just overlooked that and didn't have a problem. They always supplied you with whatever you requested. We are a very good breakfast and then either no lunch or split a small sandwich for lunch and would have a nice supper. I would definitely recommend this hotel and would stay here again if I came back to the area.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location...Not So Great Staff”
Reviews.Author: budesela
Reviews.Content: BEWARE!!! This hotel looks AMAZING on its website-Beautiful pictures with updated rooms. This is what you see on the first floor! When you stay on the 3rd/4th/5th floor, like we did, what you get is a room that is a small, old, and in desperate need of a good cleaning and some paint. I was willing at first to overlook the “no frills” accommodations when I saw how close we were to all the sights. Yes, it’s very close to the metro. And yes, it’s very close to the forums and the Colosseum. But the room was a DUMP! Our room was missing necessities on a daily basis and when requested we had to wait hours to get them. Overall, the staff was rude and not very accommodating. They often seemed as if they didn’t want to be bothered. Feel free to stay at this hotel as it is close to the major sights, but be warned, this hotel is not as it appears!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel & Great Location”
Reviews.Author: lee1966
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from a lovely 4 day stay at the Hotel and would definitely recommend it for anyone wishing to have a romantic stay in central Rome. It is only 5 minutes walk from the Central train Station. It is so close to the key places of interest, we only used a taxi once when visiting Vatican. Our room was obviously newly refurbished, spotlessly clean, with a large comfortable bed, crisp white linen sheets, flat screen TV mini bar & safe. The bathroom had double sinks and was finished in stone and marble, there were even large white fluffy bath robes and slippers. (Note like many Italian hotels there is an ironing service as there are no irons in the room) The Hotel has a real Cocktail/Piano Bar and a top class restaurant. The wine list is good and has a great selection of Italian Wines at very reasonable prices. Eating in the restaurant was a delight! The staff were always smiling and very attentive. The breakfast is served from 06:30 to 10:00 includes fruit, pastries, continental, cereal and eggs and bacon. The Hotel Staff were extremely professional, all Italians and all speaking a variety of languages including excellent English. There had great local knowledge and nothing seemed too much trouble to sort out. Hotel guests were a mix of Italians, Business Travellers and a few English Tourists. All in all this is very professionally run 4 Star Hotel with great staff, a wonderful restaurant and bar. We are going to return with friends next time. So pick this Hotel for being in central Rome. Spend your days wondering around the sights until your feet hurt. Then return to the hotel relax in with a Cocktail and eat in the resteraunt for a prefect trip.

Reviews.Title: “great value - would stay again”
Reviews.Author: tescoqueen
Reviews.Content: stayed with my sister for 2 nights in Jan 2009. The price we paid was very good and I thought this hotel was great value. It is a good 4 star in a great location. The staff are good, breakfast was nice, room was small but very comfortable. great stay.

Reviews.Title: “Good find”
Reviews.Author: pgbWisconsin
Reviews.Content: Perfect location central location. Check in was easy--staff spoke English well. Rooms were clean and very roomy. Great firm beds. Breakfast was very good. Staff very helpful. Location was about 8-10 blocks from train station but we jumped the Metro to get to the hotel. Metro station close and a good way to get around Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Great Sight-Seeing Base near the Ancient Ruins”
Reviews.Author: jackosan
Reviews.Content: We just spent 4 nights at the Grand Palatino over Valentine's Day weekend and were very impressed with the location and the quality of the lodging for the money we spent (around $150 USD per night for a top-floor executive room with a king bed and full buffet breakfast, including taxes and fees). As for the room, I'll mostly leave you to the attached pictures to judge for yourself, but it was well-maintained with some upgrades like a plasma-screen TV with satellite reception, a balcony (with a view of the Roman Forum in the distance), in-room safe (large enough to hold my laptop), bathrobes, and a nice assortment of toiletries. Housekeeping was meticulous. It would be considered a solid 3-3.5-star hotel in the US. Breakfast was a fairly extensive hot/cold buffet breakfast spread: Bacon, eggs, yogurt, fruit, a variety of baked goods, Italian hams, sausages and cheeses, and more. Cappucino and espresso are available upon request, quite enough to carry you through to dinner with a mid-afternoon snack. The hotel makes a terrific sightseeing base. The main Roman ruins are just minutes away by foot and most of historic Rome is within 20-30 minutes' walk. The hotel is right next to the Cavour Metro stop. This facilitates train travel to/from the airports, as well as many areas within and outside the city that can be reached on the Metro lines. The hotel, however, is a little far afield from some of the historical center where the Metro does not run (but its certainly still walkable). The restaurant choices nearby, while competent, are limited. On the whole, the desk staff speaks passable hotel English, but don’t expect an extended conversation. If you want to know how to get to specific places, they’ll try to sell you a tour. Overall, a smile, and an attempt to use whatever Italian (or other Romance language) you can muster, will be warmly received and reciprocated with a patient effort to help you. (Remember, Americans, you are the foreigner here!) The hotel is popular with tour groups (and for good reason). Elevators/common areas can be crowded around group arrival/departure times. Groups eat in a separate room that we ate in one morning because the other room was full. Both had the same food selection, although the service was generally better in the smaller room. A few practical suggestions – If you don’t have a lot of luggage, take the local train from the airport to Rome’s Ostiense train station (only 5.5 EUR.) Transfer there, via moving walkways to the Piramide Metro station. Take the Blue Line three stops toward Termini to Cavour (1 EUR). Walk up the steps to the main street above, turn right and walk about 100 meters. You’ll get there just as fast as the express train (perhaps faster since the local train tends to run more frequently), and save 5.5 EUR. Buy a day pass for 4 EUR, good for all-day riding on all public transportation. Take a Metro to a good starting point (perhaps the Spanish Steps) and then wander around, hopping on and off the Metro/Buses as you and your feet please. Be aware that there are separate entrances on o the Cavour station, depending on which direction you are traveling. Taxis become very expensive, very quickly, but they do know where they are going. You might not, even with a map. At the wine/cheese/pizza store down the street by the bank machine, tell the guy what you want to spend on a bottle of wine and trust his selection. Some real winners in the under 15 EUR category!

Reviews.Title: “Noisy and too far from any good restaurants”
Reviews.Author: Adam B
Reviews.Content: I did not get a good feeling about this hotel from the moment we arrived. On an extremely busy street and very noisy. The staff always seemed to know best and tended to be either pushy or not there. We waited for nearly 30 minutes for a barperson to appear to serve us drinks on lunch time. Our room was quite large though could not be described as luxurious. The bathroom was directly connected to the one next door via the extractor so ABSOLUTELY every sound could be heard. The room was airless but because it overlooked the busy street there was no chance of an open window. I bought earplugs after the first night. Breakfast was a complete mad-house with various items scattered around the room cold meats at one end hot dishes somewhere else. The juices were very poor quality and the rolls were not fresh every morning. A dinner served to the group was just awful. Rissoto and pasta dumped on the same plate and then a piece of very tough veal large enough to feed a family of 8 serevd with massively greasy potatoes. We were only offered the house wine and when we insisted on the wine list discovered that the same wine by the bottle was 10 euros cheaper. The most unfortunate incident occurred when we asked reseption to recommend a good restaurant and book us a taxi. They gave us the name of the restaurant but not the address. They failed to provide the taxi driver with this so we ended up being dumped in the right general area of Rome but Many many metres away from the address. After a further 10euro taxi ride we eventually arrived at what we thought was going to be a good establishment serving Roman food. It was small scruffy and Sardinian. When we returned to the hotel we were met with insincere apologies. There were no decent eating places near the hotel and after a futile search the next night we returned to the hotels much advertised restaurant. It was completely lacking customers, atmosphere or correct service. Great flourishing of silver domed plates did nothing to hide the inferior cooking and presentation. Slimy described both food and service

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location! Beautiful inside.”
Reviews.Author: RubinandOskar
Reviews.Content: I loved this hotel, it was very spacious and clean. The location was perfect with many places to eat, shop and sighsee just steps away. I would reccomend this hotel to anyone traveling to Rome we had a great stay!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Location, Nice Breakfst, Helpful Staff”
Reviews.Author: ChattiPatti
Reviews.Content: I spent six nights at the Hotel Palatino and loved the hotel. My room was spacious and comfortable with a cozy chair. The breakfast each morning was lovely-polenta with sausage, eggs, bacon, hard rolls, cornettas, juice, fruit and freshly sliced salami and proscutti. Coffee and hot milk on the table.Cappacinos on request. Location was perfect- about a block or two from the Colessum. Internet cafe across the street with Bruno playing 70's music! But skip his gelato and head behind the hotel to Ciuri Ciuri. 2 Euro for Doppa Blu!!! And the cannoli are freshly stuffed. Wander the alleyways and find La Taverna dei Fori Imperiali for the chef's special. Gnocchi in gorgonzola -yum. Also Wanted down the block for pasta bags of pear/walnut or great fettucine. Front desk is patient and helpful. I tried my guidebook Italian and they unfailingly helped me first improve my pronunication and then answered any question. St. Peter's in Chains is across the street and up a steep stair-check hours before you climb!

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: GodisGoood
Reviews.Content: For Rome this hotel was excellent for the price. we booked a triple room and it was great. the beds were comfy after a long days walk in rome. there is a bus stop just out of the hotel. there is a supermarket across the stree. there is a metro stop 2min away. 5min walk to the colosseum. if your in rome to see sights all day then i would book this hotel. we were on the top floor on the side where we faced the busy street. with the windows closed it did not bother us. however in the summer when you would want the windows open i would request a room in advance on the other side of the hotel as i could see it might be pretty noisy. the breakfast was great. there are plently of places to eat near by. there is a internet/ice cream shop across from the hotel as well. the staff was excellent. this hotel is really underpriced for rome. i wish it was higher in the rankings for people to pick this hotel. we looked hours before we booked and we so happy with this hotel. we used hotels.com and paid 91-119euros per night.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: LE3693
Reviews.Content: Very happy with our stay. Fantastic location. It's the first train stop from Termini station. Hotel was one block from metro stop. Hotel was above average; not sure I would give it four stars, but we were very comfortable in our room. $198 usd per night included taxes and full (and decent) breakfast. My two teenage kids and and I stayed in a tripple (three twin beds). Air conditioning worked great - very hot in Italy in August. When we left the hotel and walked two blocks, we could see the Coliseum to our left (a few blocks away). The hotel's streeet (Via Cavour) ends at the foot of all of Ancient Rome (probably three or four blocks from the hotel). Walked everywhere . . . to St. Peter's Square (probably 1 mile) to Trevi Fountain to Spanish Steps (probably 1 mile as well). If you want to stay in the heart of Italy at a fabulously located and comfortable hotel, stay at the Grand Hotel Palatino.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel and fab location”
Reviews.Author: YummyTwinMummy
Reviews.Content: My 10 year old daughter and I took my mother to Rome for her 65th birthday and stayed for 4 days. We booked a city break through Travelocity and chose the Grand Hotel Palatino after reading the reviews on here. We were not disappointed in the slightest and had a fabulous hotel stay. We checked in around 11.30am and were immediately shown to our room. We had booked a triple Classic room and were very impressed. The room was of above average size for European hotels and the bathroom was very clean but just a bit rough around the edges. The air conditioning in the room worked extremely well and helped cope to with horrid temperatures outside. The room was tidied daily and even had our beds turned down in the evenings. The hotel staff were wonderful in helping find places to dine as well as the easiest routes to the sights of Rome. We had a buffet breakfast included in our package and the food was plentiful and quite yummy. It was replenished often and something for everyone. The apricot filled croissants were to die for. It was an amazing trip and I would definitely stay there again. There was outside scaffolding on the building when we arrived and I was rather worried but we never heard a sound in our room (Room 212).

Reviews.Title: “Great location, pity about the hotel staff ......”
Reviews.Author: TajjUK
Reviews.Content: This hotel is on Via Cavour in central Rome. Its location is just so ideal. Just 5 minutes walk away is the Colosseum, Roman Forum, Palatino, Termini station (Rome's main train station), and the Via Imperioli which has numerous sites to see. The Church of San Giovanni is not so far away either. You can also walk to Piazza Navona, Trevi Fountain and the Spanish Steps, which are about 25 mins away, and on the way there, you get to see other sites and the life in the city. The hotel is clean. The breakfast is fine. Scrambled eggs, croissants, buns, tea, coffee, slices of bread, cornflakes, fruits and juices. But the staff and concierge are unhelpful and unco-operative. They dont seem too pleased to help when you ask them a question. I asked about the tourbus which stops outside the hotel. The staff member looked down at his desk as I asked him and he just brushed me off by saying "I dont know" with an unpleasant look on his face ! I asked another staff member about local restaurants and he also shrugged his shoulders without saying a word ! The breakfast area is split in two - I dont know why this was. On our first day there, I went into one room to get some bread. On the next day, a member of staff created a bit of a scene by speaking loudly that I should not be in the other breakfast area, even though others were. Embarassing. Ive stayed at many hotels around the world and Ive been treated with courtesy and the staff there were always keen to help. But the people running the Grand Palatino were absolutely useless.

Reviews.Title: “Good value for location and quality”
Reviews.Author: mojohomer
Reviews.Content: I stay at this hotel when I have to make quick stopovers in Rome and don't want to spend too much, Florence Hotel Group hotels offer good value but lacks in quality. Front desk service and friendliness is average, I booked a Deluxe room on the top floor, it came with a nice balcony and a nice view (depend on which side of the top floor you stay you may not get a balcony with a view). The location is just minutes away from Roman Forum, Palantine Hill, Coloseo and the train station, but it's far from the main shopping area.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Junior Suite”
Reviews.Author: ChloeAthens
Reviews.Content: The Palatino Grand Hotel, is situated about 500 metres from the Colosseum. The junior suite we stayed in, looked like it belonged to a different hotel. It was very big and beautifully decorated. It had 2 flat screen TVs, a large marble bathroom, a walk in closet and was spotlessly clean. (Maybe they have only renovated the junior suites and are in the process of renovating the rest, as it looked nothing like the traveller photos on trip advisor). The staff was indifferent, and you were pretty much on your own. Breakfast was bellow average, and they served instant coffee, which they poured for you from fancy coffee pots.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: visitorDxb
Reviews.Content: I stayed there for 2 days along with my family. Excellent check in staff, very helpful. adequate breakfast. located very close to the colleseum and the ruins. You can take the guided tour from the Hotel to Vatican and St Peters Basillica. across the street , the indian restaurant is an excellent choice for vegeterian food

Reviews.Title: “Okay for a few days”
Reviews.Author: londoner888
Reviews.Content: The hotel is close to the colloseum, the trains and metro stations are within walking distance. However, I would not give this hotel a 4 star rating. The staff are friendly and polite but their eagerness to not knock on doors to get in and clean our room is too much. I was woken up everyday by a cleaner marching in my room despite showing a 'do not disturb' sign. The breakfast definately was a major let down, same old food such as hard bread rolls, tinned fruit, ham and cheese. The hotel room does not have a kettle- so anyone wishing to boil water bring your own travel kettle. Complimentary water is not available either- despite the hot weather and supposedly a 4 star status. Make sure you buy water/drinks in the supermarkets whenever you get a chance its 80% cheaper! However, anyone wanting to buy souvenirs, its so much cheaper to buy it at the shops next to the hotel, everywhere else will charge you ridiculous prices. Also anyone wanting to visit the major sites- buy a Roma pass from the information point near the colloseum, its £20 Euro's and you can enter 2 major sites and discounts off others, plus 3 days travel card- best bargain throughout the whole trip- we skipped the 2 hour long queue going into the colloseum with this pass. Overall, Rome was lovely but expensive and the hotel is in an excellent location for a few nights only!

Reviews.Title: “Really Liked the Palatino”
Reviews.Author: gir7375
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 4 nights and found the location to be ideal. Very close to the Coloseum and the Palatine Hill ruins. Also, we like the proximity of the Metro station which, we used frequently during our stay. The rooms were large and clean, good air conditioning. They seem to need a bit of an update but I liked the style overall. Breakfast was fine but not a great selection compared to some of the other hotels on our trip but still better than the standard Continental European style. Reception was very nice and we found the area to have some really nice restaurants. I would recomend this hotel for those traveling by rail and who like to focus on Ancient Rome since there are so many ruins in the area within walking distance

Reviews.Title: “When in Rome...”
Reviews.Author: clairelybelgian
Reviews.Content: We chose this hotel for it's location- it is situated on a main road that connects Termini Station with the Colloseum. It is probably a 5-10 min walk from the hotel to the Colloseum and the Roman Forum, which is a plus with all the walking that you do in Rome! It is about 15 mins from Termini, where the train from the airport comes in, so it's an easy transfer. If you're not a keen walker, which given the way that the Romans drive is understandable, the hop on/off sightseeing bus stops directly oustide the hotel, every hour or so I think. It is a great way to see the architectural features of the buildings and take good pictures of the ruins, it stops at all the useful tourist spots you could want. On to the rooms, they are fairly standard and non descript in that general hotel way, but are very clean, as are the bathrooms. We had a room overlooking the Via Cavour, which is noisy if you open the window as you would expect from a main street in Rome, they won't drive quietly! The room had adequate air conditioning, which I thought would be a good feature for Rome in late summer. The staff on the front desk were a little grumpy, but I had the impression that most people in Rome were feeling a little grumpy that week, perhaps because it was at the end of summer and they were getting sick of tourists or something. Food- We did not eat in the hotel restaurant and chose to eat down the Via Cavour towards the coloseum, the restaurants are very good, though not all staff speak english so have that phrasebook handy! They are a little touristy but the quality is still very good. Do not eat in the restaurant right next door to the hotel, it is terrible!! I am sure that they microwaved my lasagne, which in Italy should be a crime. There is a fab pizza place on a little back street near the basilica Santa Maria Maggiore that our guidebook, one of the eyewitness jobbies, recommended, it actually had some very good restaurants in. I would also recommend the smaller restaurant in the Exedra hotel on the Piazza della Republica, the food was superb and the manager was only too happy to give us a crash course on Italian wines and recommended a wonderful barolo to compliment our brilliant food. It is a tad pricey there though.

Reviews.Title: “An above average hotel with ideal location”
Reviews.Author: Montreal_Canadiens
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel in early June 2008. It is an above average hotel. Our room was clean and quiet (on the roof) but small by american standards (but fine by European standards). Our room had a LCD TV with access to english channels. Staff was friendly, courteous and helpful. We were given an upgrade on arrival to an executive room on the 8th floor. The greatest asset of this hotel is its location and comfort. In my opinion, you can't find a better location to visit Rome's attractions minus the Vatican which is a little far. The coliseum and the Forum are 5 minutes walk. Pantheon, most fountains and Plazas are accessible by walk. Beds are comfortable and air conditioning is working fine. We have not been bother by any noises from the streets below nor from neighboring rooms. You also have access to a safe. There are many restaurants near the hotel. You may also find useful to know that the subway station Cavour is 4 minutes walk from the hotel (on the little street behind the hotel). From this station you have access to all of major attractions in the city. This being said, walking is the best way to get acquainted with the city's attractions if physical conditions permit to walk few hours, of course. My assessment of this hotel would have been higher with a better breakfast and free internet. You get eggs, bacon, bread cereals, yogurt and croissant, fruit salad and juices. Not extensive choice but ok to give a good start to your day. Also, I find the prices overrated compare to other hotels I have stayed on other trips (in other countries). However, for Rome, this hotel is fairly priced. I would stay there again without hesitation.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the location”
Reviews.Author: bnzlvr
Reviews.Content: We had a very nice time at the Palatino in Rome. Because there was a mix up with our room the first night, they arranged alternate accommodations for us that night, upgraded us for the remainder of our stay, and treated us to a free dinner in their restaurant. Our upgraded room was on the top floor of the hotel, and featured french doors leading to a small balcony. We were delighted with it, though we found the mattress and pillows hard and the sheets a bit rough. The room was impeccably clean and the bathroom was large (by European standards) and elegant, with both a rainfall and a hand-held shower, marble tile, dual sinks, lighted makeup mirror, terry robes and slippers, etc.. There are two dining rooms: one for tour groups and the other for individuals. The breakfast buffet served to individual travelers was excellent. There was a large variety of food - something for every taste. The location of the hotel is fantastic. It was amazing to be able to saunter two blocks to the ruins of the coliseum and Constantine's arch anytime we had a few free minutes, and to see the ruins of a Roman forum every day! The hotel seems to cater to large tour groups, so be prepared for crowds in the lobby at times. It would be nice if they had somebody available 24/7 to help with wifi problems; I prepaid 10 euros/hour and was unable to access the internet..

Reviews.Title: “Great experience”
Reviews.Author: chasnative
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Palatino for three nights in mid-April. It was a wonderful experience. Upon check, they immediately upgraded us to a full suite. It was enormous. Large sitting area with desk, loveseat, chair, ottoman and flat screen TV. Bedroom was also huge with King sized bed, 3 chairs, a little table and another flat screened TV. Bathroom was gorgeous. Dual sinks, huge tub, and a nice separate shower (one of the few problems we had was that the showr soaked the floor no matter which direction we tried to direct the shower head) The breakfast was nice. Eggs, bacon, 2 types of cereal, several breads and jams, a selection of meats and chesses, and several juices or coffees to choose from. Although we tried to ask very little of the staff, any requests were dealt with quickly and politely. The location is excellent. It is an easy walk to ancient Rome and the train station. The Trevi Fountain is a bit further, but a very pleasant walk. For us, the Vatican was an easy (and cheap) Metro ride but then we wandered back to the hotel on foot. There are several bars and restaurants nearby. We enjoyed Cavour 313. The wine shop down the street is close and quite good. The post office is right there as is an ATM machine. We had no real complaints and would certainly stay here again. The only slight negatives we found were that the pillows were a bit hard and the breakfst room got very busy sometimes.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome”
Reviews.Author: fish2008
Reviews.Content: The hotel was beautiful, the location perfect, and the staff friendly. My husband and I had a great experience. The neighborhood also felt safe at night and we had no problem using the metro system right next to the hotel. We were walking distance from ancient Rome and absolutely loved it!!

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Palatino”
Reviews.Author: mrsgeorgie
Reviews.Content: Palatino Grand Hotel is lovely. Service was fabulous.. breakfast was very good the rooms was quite large (we stayed here two times in a three week period). The first time we were in a basic room on the 6th floor..it was nice.. good size bed, bathroom etc.. the second time we stayed in room 160 (a corner junior suite) 2 showers..and one tub..two sinks..very large room. My husband and I loved it. The location is fabulous..and if you get sick of Italian food (hahah) try the Indian place across the street..it is very good.

Reviews.Title: “Loved this Hotel”
Reviews.Author: melson3
Reviews.Content: We stayed 4 nights at Grand Palatino in late March 2008 and loved it. We were very lucky--we were given 2 rooms on the top (8th floor). Each room had its own balcony; each faced the back of the hotel, with views of the rest of the city, including St. Peter's dome and the Victor Emmanuel monument in the distance. They had just finished the renovations, so perhaps that is how we had the good luck to get these rooms. We were in room 802, which is actually a suite, and has 2 balconies. Each room (our kids were at the opposite end of the floor in room 812) was reasonably large; ours had 2 flat screen tvs; both had minibars and safes (use them!!!!!--I had my wallet stolen on a bus). The beds were incredibly comfortable, and each room comes with slippers and bathrobes. Tons of towels; 2 showers in our room (one as part of a giant bathtub); turn-down service at night (one night they seemed to forget; maybe because it was Sunday and they have fewer staff.) The hotel location is very convenient--it is about a 10-12 minute (not 5!) walk from the Colosseum, but easy. It's barely 75 yards from the nearest metro stop, which itself is only 1 stop from the Stazioni Termini. It's also barely 2 minutes up steps across the street from the church San Pietro in Vincoli--which has the Michelangelo statue of Moses inside it (no charge to enter). This is one of the most impressive statues you will ever see, in my opinion. Metro: We reached the Vatican stop (which requires transferring) in less than 20 minutes by metro from the stop near the hotel. It's an easy c. 15 minute walk to the Piazza Venezia and c. 20-25 minutes to the Trevi Fountain (go at night!). The hotel breakfast buffet was quite large and satsifying; service was a bit indifferent; you can order any version of coffee you wish (also, tea, etc.). Staff at the front desk were generally helpful to very helpful; certainly did not encounter anyone who was rude or unhelpful. They were very good about letting us leave our luggage in a secure room after arriving at c. 11 am. All in all, this one of the best hotels we have ever stayed at; if you can get a room with a view (rear, not street), it's hard to believe you will regret staying here. We got our rooms as part of a travel package, so I don't know what they cost if purchased a la carte.

Reviews.Title: “Surpassed our expectations!”
Reviews.Author: Lor45
Reviews.Content: I had arranged this trip to Rome to celebrate my best friends 50th birthday. On the 1st February we said goodbye to kids, husbands, housework and cooking and set of for an adventure in Rome. I saw reviews for this hotel on Tripadvisor and most seemed very positive, so I booked it. On arriving at the hotel we found we had been allocated a really spacious room with twin beds and a separate sofa. The decor was fine and everything was very clean. Beds were comfortable and next morning we went down for breakfast and where very impressed with the variety on offer. Breakfast sustained us right through the day and we only had coffee and a pastry in the afternoon. Via Cavour is so central with metro stations on the corner and Colosseum and Forum at the bottom of the road!! The sightseeing tour bus stopped right outside the hotel and we did this on Saturday morning and it was brilliant! There are lots of restaurants in and around the hotel. We enjoyed meals in a Chinese, Indian, Italian, and Argentinian restaurant all on or just of the Via Cavour. The quality and price was excellent and we really enjoyed all our meals ( The most we paid was 50 Euros and that was for starters, main courses a bottle of wine and a bottle of water!) We found the hotel staff very helpful and polite. When I visit Rome again (I will definitely go back) I won't be searching around for a different hotel, I will be booking the hotel Palatino. If you are looking for a clean, comfortable and central hotel in Rome, book this one! Lorraine and Val. Ballyclare. Northern Ireland.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: oilfriedghost
Reviews.Content: The location is fantastic. A few minutes from the Via Cavour metro station and you're off to anywhere in Rome. Literally a stone throw away from the Colosseum, and a few minutes walk to the Roman Forum. We had the complimentary breakfast every morning which was buffet style; scrambled eggs, croissants, juice, bacon, sausage, etc... The staff was friendly and always pleasant. Will stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Close to main sights”
Reviews.Author: Utahparkslover
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Grand Hotel Palatino as part of a tour group. The room was clean and comfortable and the breakfast buffet was more than plentiful. It is only a 5 minute walk to the Colosseum and a few minutes farther to the other main sights (Roman Forum, Trajan's Markets, Campidoglio, Monument to Victor Emmanuel, etc.) and the steps leading to the Basilica of St. Peter in Chains are right across the street. I will definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Rubbish”
Reviews.Author: manxboy
Reviews.Content: Well - the 8th floor is being renovated, so be expected to be woken up at 0730 by the sound of power tools and general hammering. Upon checking out the staff on duty were rude, surly and generally apathetic. Pretty much as they were upon checking in. They couldn't care less. Breakfast - Adequate, staff very nice. Room - Okay. Avoid and be treated sympathetically and respectfully elsehwere.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: Venturer88
Reviews.Content: Just spent the Thanksgiving week in Rome and my wife and I stayed at the Hotel Palatino. Located along Via Cavour, the Palatino has a great location, within walking distance of the Colosseum; the Forum, Palatine Hill, 2 of the 4 major Roman Catholic basilicas, trattorias, bars and alumentaris (grocery stores). They have a great breakfast buffet, which is a perfect way to start our daily walking ventures in the city. The only thing that marred our stay was the seeming indifference of the hotel staff when they are asked to address simple, valid requests. Like when we asked that our room thermostat be fixed (the room was unbearably hot and the request was ignored) or the time when we asked for change for a 10 Euro bill (the request was ignored because they claimed they had no loose change, although it was clear in full view that they had a lot available). Also, they do not want to be inconvenienced by guests in any way- so be mindful if the staff is on the phone making personal calls, they do not want to be interrupted.

Reviews.Title: “Good Location, good breakfast”
Reviews.Author: tn1933
Reviews.Content: HI, Searched high and low for a good hotel in Rome. we paid abot $1000 for 4 nights a Thursday - Monday. Hotel was good, clean, excellent breakfast, far enough from train station, close to colleseum. Hotel staff's english was not so good, and when we asked for some basic tourist questions they were not so helpful but overal experience was good. Rooms are standard size for european hotels.

Reviews.Title: “Lived up to its reviews”
Reviews.Author: FenTraveller68
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in a great location just up the street from the Forum and Colosseum. The hotel lived up to its very good reviews and I would thoroughly recommend it. There are a number of good reasonably priced restaurants to the rear, we particularly liked 'Wanted', and there are a some good shops on Via Cavour that sell portions of pizza for lunch. Top tip - visit the Palatine before the colosseum - the ticket covers entry to both attractions and the queues at the former are a fraction of those at the latter. Just make sure you join the entry queue at the colosseum (keep to the left) and not the ticket queue (on the right side)!

Reviews.Title: “Highly recommended”
Reviews.Author: Su-Mart
Reviews.Content: This hotel exceeded my expectations. Booked on line a few days before we went. Good porterage, pleasant & helpful reception staff on reception who offered immediate advise on what to do that evening (unknown to us we'd arrived on 'white night'), public areas clean & very attractive. Had a superior room on back of hotel which was so spacious (advise you book a standard double & upgrade on arrival if not happy with that). King bed very, very comfortable, room clean, fridge cold, tea & coffee in room. Bathroom was the surprise as I'd read so many poor reviews & my partner is a big guy so I was worried that it would be small but it was huge with proper shower in large cubicle with bath on the other side within an inset - with another two (yes two) showers over it! Hotel was right in the heart of it all within Roma - did the hop on hop off bus tour thing which we booked at the Termini. Shops are very nearby so you can buy drinks to chill in your fridge for when you get back after a busy day out & about. Our room was on the back but I reckon that the insulation is such that a front facing room would not suffer noise or light intrusion. Air con. very effective & controllable. Negatives: Breakfast wasn't great by UK/US standards but acceptable & varied

Reviews.Title: “Wouldn't stay anywhere else in Rome!”
Reviews.Author: travel255
Reviews.Content: My wife and I initially stayed at this hotel in 2005, and were very pleased with the accommodation, cleanliness, service and location. This year, celebrating our 10th wedding anniversary, we decided to visit Paris and then Rome, staying at the Palatino. We booked directly with the hotel and the staff were very helpful. As to the hotel itself, our experience was even better this time. In particular, the hotel has greatly improved its buffet breakfast and provides a very large, good quality selection. The Palatino is also ideally located, being really within walking distance of all of the main sites. This is great in the evening, as 5 minutes takes you to the Forum, Coliseum and Capatolino, while a little further and you at the Trevi, Pantheon and Spanish Steps. The area around the hotel also seems very safe at night, unlike some of the streets nearer to Termini. There are also a large number of cheap but very good eateries all around the hotel. In short, we love Rome and we'll definitely go back soon. We would never stay anywhere else but this hotel. Great hotel - great staff - great location!

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel!”
Reviews.Author: cb333
Reviews.Content: We stayed here in Aug for 4 days. rooms were newly renovated. We had a junior suite (room 158) and it was a perfect stay. Rooms are spanking new, bright, roomy, cool A/C, awesome showers. breakfast included in the stays too! Staffs are ok, not the most friendly person but they get the job done. location is prime, 10 min walk to colosuem, 3 min walk to metro (via cavour). we would 100% certain we'll stay here again the next time we visit room.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel & location with just a couple gotchas to watch for”
Reviews.Author: hatlad
Reviews.Content: OK... first the goods: Location is wonderful for walking to most anything - especially the Coliseum and Forum which are a mere block away or so. Michelangelo's "Moses" is just a stair climb across the street in the Basillica of St Peter in Chains. If mass transit is your thing, the Metro station is just up the street half a block & down 1 flight of stairs. A block or 2 up the way is the train station too. If cabbing is in your budget, you can zip anywhere in central Rome in minutes (we did taxi to Hard Rock Cafe & was 8 Euro for 2 passengers & there in mere minutes). Also, the neighborhood around the hotel is safe and there's a great local Roman place just behind the hotel & up from the Metro station (Suburra's) which is great food, plentiful and quite affordable and quaint. And almost right next door towards the Forum is another great little place that's only slightly more expensive. (I can't comment about the hotel restaurant as unfortunately we never had time or convenience to use it.) There's also in-lobby internet available with a credit card at 3 Euro/hour. If that doesn't work for you there are several internet cafe's scattered just around the hotel. Room was clean, comfortable & as quiet as being on a major street in a big city would allow, so no problems there. Maid service was excellent, minibar was well-stocked and there were in-room safes for valuables while you're away. Now the bads: No hot water seemed to be the rule almost the entire 4 night stay (think we had hot water once (at 4 AM our last morning). However, others on our tour did not experience this problem so could've just been a thing with our room. In-room internet was worthless & THE most complicated procedure involving the TV remote, a remote keyboard and menus on the TV. We tried first night & after started accruing charges, couldn't make the keyboard work. The front desk said they would send someone up to look at it and after an hour of waiting we gave up & asked they canceled the charges. They didn't immediately do so & it took some negotiating, but they eventually did cancel the charges. Also, watch out for using the in-room phone for phone card calls; you'll still get a hotel line charge for your "free" phone card call. But, other than those 2 things, this hotel was just fine. Their free breakfast "buffet" was probably THE best such we experienced between 3 major cities in Italy. We would stay here again, quite likely.

Reviews.Title: “Decent hotel but on the expensive side”
Reviews.Author: helenc4410
Reviews.Content: The Hotel was very pleasant, with nice rooms (if a bit on the small side). The location is wonderful, and within a few minutes walking distance of some of the most famous attractions in the world (probably explains the expense). Staff were friendly and courteous.

Reviews.Title: “Lovley Central Hotel”
Reviews.Author: vez_7
Reviews.Content: Lovely hotel within 10mins walk of romestermini(station) and within easy walking distance of romes colusseum and other attractions.fabulous self service breakfast.rooms all aircon,and beauifully furnished. the staff were very friendly and helpful,and the rooms mini bar wasnt too exspensive. We booked the hotel 4days before we travelled and therefore got it at a dicounted rate which made it even better. My only concern was the Baileys! It might have come out of a baileys bottle but it was definatley not the real thing.That said would i recommend this hotel and go back again?definatley.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, fluffly towels”
Reviews.Author: Peggysuz
Reviews.Content: Just a few blocks from the Coliseum, this hotel's location would be the major attraction. When I checked in I had to firmly insist that the room I was assigned be non-smoking as requested. A bit of trouble with a sticky shower control level was remedied quickly when I phoned the desk for assistance. Unfortunately, on each of the 3 days I spent at the hotel, my room key needed to be reset upon returning after my day's activities. As a guest staying on her own, I was offered cappuccino with my breakfast. The buffet was quite adequate. Once my status changed to being a member of a tour group this disappeared. Another tour couple that ate in the hotel dining room exclaimed that it was the finest dinners they had eaten in a hotel restaurant.

Reviews.Title: “Near the Colliseum but that's as good as it gets.”
Reviews.Author: Maxine37
Reviews.Content: I am unsure how to start this review as I do not wish to appear too negative, however.... Firstly - we drove into Rome city centre after hiring a car from Ciampino airport ( wow, big mistake, the Italian drivers show little courtesy to other road users be they motorists or pedestrians and to be truthful, they show little road sense at all.) Of course, we thought we knew how bad the driving would be but we were wrong, it was far worse, common courtesy and etiquette appear to an unknown quantity to the commonal Italian driver! So, by the time we found the Hotel Palatino (thank goodness for GPS) we pulled up reassured that we would at least be able to park the car, they advertise garage space after all. But no, we were wrong, in fact the garage was full that day and they gave instructions for a garage elsewhere (again, thank goodness for GPS) that might have spaces. After much hooting and swearing, we found the garage which did have a space but for the cost of 25 euro for 24 hours - we were desperate by this time and grabbed the space. Armed with suitcases and hand luggage we trekked the 10 minutes to the hotel a little flustered but it was ok, we were on holiday after all. The reception staff seemed reasonably friendly although I got the distinct impression they were not actually that happy to see us. Our room reminded me very much of a UK Traveldoge room - certainly clean and sparse but without the luxury of tea/coffee making facilities which would be expected as standard in Travelodge. The Colliseum is certainly nearby and yes, we enjoyed our evening sightseeing - Rome was not the focal point for this trip but a starting point for my 40th birthday trip to climb Mount Vesuvius. Friday morning we awoke for breakfast and were ready to further explore Rome before leaving that afternoon. Off we headed to the breakfast room only to be met by a waiter who made us feel distinctly uncomfortable ( after thanking him for bringing a pot of tea to the table he said "don't thank me, I am only able to feed myself and my family because of visitors to the hotel - I should thank you".) Within seconds of this statement, as I went to collect a bread roll and jam for breakfast, he further accosted me to tell me that although he wasnt the 'big boss' only the 'little boss' would I please mind not wearing my Birkenstocks into breakfast the next day but more appropriate footwear? I was seething (did he not know how much Birkenstocks cost) and this pretentiousness and idiocy made me snarl at him that there would be no way I would be at breakfast the next morning. An Italian sitting alongside me smiled at me sympathetically as if to say he didn't mind at all if I wore my Birkenstocks to breakfast but the damage was done, we got up and packed pretty quick smart - of course, the waiter had no idea we'd left as he'd already accosted a group of French tourists by then! We headed to Sorrento which was much improved and our hotel was lovely. Neither myself nor my husband are the 'city type' and we are not pretentious at all, we are perfectly happy to accept absolutely any footwear to breakfast at 8.30am, so perhaps we were wrong to book this hotel. Regardless, I would not recommend it as we did not have a happy stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect hotel for a long weekend”
Reviews.Author: LillieUk
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel based on reviews on tripadvisor and were not disappointed so wanted to write the reivew so others can benefit from this great find! The Palatino Grand Hotel is in the perfect loction, very safe, a 2 minute walk from the tube which is a one stop connection to the Termini Station, or a ten minute walk direct to the main Termini Station where you can get the tube to any of the attractions. It's also a couple of blocks away from the Colosseum - a very central hotel. You can pretty much walk to all the popular attractions and we only travelled by tube twice in our 4 day stay - we definately burnt off the calories consumed eating all the fabulous food Rome has to offer (the Pizza's are to die for!) The Hotel itself is a very nice 4star, the rooms are clean and well equipped, the hotel staff are very friendly and willing to help. The breakfast is fairly standard, fruit, pastries, cereal, tea, coffee, juice etc. If you get the chance try one of the coffees in the hotel bar... we finished off every day of walking and sightseeing with an Irish Coffee in the bar! If we went back to Rome I would definately stay at this hotel and would recommend it. Overall we had a brilliant 4 day break however a few tips that may make your trip easier: If flying with Alitalia make sure you eat before you travel... their plane food is the most disgsting I have ever had (and I've travelled with a lot of different airlines). I thought as Alitalia was the National Airline of Italy, I was expecting more, it's fine, and functional but nothing more than a budget airline. The second tip is be prepared to queue and do some research on what days you want to visit different attractions. The queue for the Vatican Museum on a Monday (it's worse at the weekends) was over two hours long. If your budget can stretch to it, go with a tour as you can queue jump and on the two tours that we did (Colosseum and Vatican Museum) the tour guides really knew their stuff and made the experience much more enjoyable. The third tip is try and book a taxi direct with your travel booker from the Airport to your hotel in Rome. We paid when we booked the trip and after hearing all the stories about being ripped off by the taxi drivers at the airport it was nice to have someone collect you (plus it worked out much cheaper). We also got the train back to the airport from the Termini station, it goes every half hour is very safe and clean and only costs 11 euro per person, it takes 30 minutes door to door! The last tip is for the ladies... 95% of the streets in Rome are cobbled so don't even bother taking your heels! Despite all the reviews saying that the Romas dress up to the nines, we only saw a handful of glamorous looking women and that was in the shopping district. All the tourist attractions are populated by tourists - jeans, jumpers and backpacks were the norm. Lastly, have a fab trip, Rome is amazing!

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable stay...”
Reviews.Author: NickNewJersey
Reviews.Content: Hotel lived up to its expectation. Not 5-star but nevertheless, very comfortable stay and close (by Metro or bus) to all sites. Good and inexpensive restaurant (La Vecchia) behind hotel. Ask front desk to make a reservation. They were turning people away at 8:30pm on a Wed night. Typical Roman fare. Travel by bus around city is very easy - just pick up a map from a tabacco store. Definately visit Trastevere for dinner. Plenty of restaurants with locals. Overall, hotel stay was very confortable. Do ask for a room on the high floors. New Jersey, USA

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: Whystlar
Reviews.Content: Just back from 3 lovely days at this hotel. Rooms are pleasant and comfortable, we had an executive double with a balcony and views in the distance of the Forum. Close to the Metro which takes you throughout the city and only a couple of hundred yards from the Colosseum and walking distance to many other famous sites. Good food at the restaurant and pleasing atmosphere, staff polite and pleasant at all times. For a short break to the ''Eternal City'' this is a fine choice

Reviews.Title: “excellent location”
Reviews.Author: jack63
Reviews.Content: just came back last week from 4 fabulous days in rome! the hotel is within walking distance of the colisseum in fact if you go out the hotel turn right go to the first set of lights and look across to your left the collisseum is there infront of you.WOW the room in the hotel was nice nothing very fancy but ample for a few days massive bed, bathroom was fine,shower a bit small but its only for a few days so it does'nt matter, the sheets were changed daily and everything was SPOTLESS . the breakfast wasnt up to much the usual continental stuff cold meats etc- went to the VATICAN and that was the icing on the cake,saw the Pope on sunday went back monday and would've gone back tuesday except we were going home and had to visit the colosseum before we went back! took a tour well worth it --you get to know so much more from the guides WELL WORTH the money the weather was unbelievable for february warm sunshine in the shade still cold. WHAT TO WEAR just make sure you have comfy walking shoes we walked everywhere even to the vatican once we found our feet it was lovely just stop every now and then for a coffee or a beer beware of the prices very expensive! I think if you're going to rome in the winter months all you need is a couple ofpairs of jeans and polonecks a nice coat ,hat,gloves and dont forget the essentialSUNGLASSES. i like to dress up at night bit it just was'nt that kind of place maybe in the summer but not in the winter months we really enjoyed our stay would definatly recommend the hotel as everything is so near -all the main sights AIRPORT TRANSFERS we got the terrorvision bus direct from the airport to the termini station it was only about £10 each return . the bus runs in connection with easyjet so if the flight is delayed the bus will wait for you and they tell you what time to get picked up for your flight home-- i found this an excellent service as we were prepared to get a private transfer for about £60 return. the hotel is about a 10-15 minute walk from the station, its a straight road all the way down just keep walking its on the right hand side of VIA CAVOUR anyone will tell you. you think the hotel is far from the station but thats ok cos you dont need to be near the station everything is down the bottom end of the hotel so its a great base for exploring HOPE THIS HELPED YOU CIAO

Reviews.Title: “What you see is not what you get”
Reviews.Author: Chicago7
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel based on other reviews from the trip advisor and the photos posted by the hotel. Well, the looks can be deceiving. The lobby area is very nice, tasteful decor. However, once you pass the lobby and go up to your room, the décor deteriorates drastically. The rooms have post war shabbiness about them. The carpet in the rooms and the hallways is stained and peeling. The hallway walls are scratched up. The bathroom is so tiny that when you seat on a toilet you touch BD with your legs. Needless to say those bathrooms two are in a dire need of upgrade. Everything smells unsanitary. The room furniture was in a very poor condition, with cracks and breaks in a wood. If you have every been unfortunate to stay in a Motel 6, then you will experience an unpleasant Deja-Vu. In other words, steer away. They lure you in with pretty website pictures and nice lobby and you end up in a very dirty, shabby room.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel OK, location not great”
Reviews.Author: LondonLondoner
Reviews.Content: First the good news: the location is handy for the Colosseum and the metro. But sadly the two things you *don't* need in Rome are to be close to the Colosseum or close to the metro: for a start you'll probably only visit the Colosseum once, and the metro doesn't go anywhere visitors want to go (it's not easy to dig tunnels under the Roman city). And the location downside is that half the rooms look out over one of Rome's busiest roads. If you like sleeping either keep the windows shut and sweat (no aircon in January) or try to sleep through the sound of a thousand Vespas. The bedrooms are clean but they don't look to have been refurbished in recent years. Hair dryer fell apart. Downstairs the foyer and bar are usually empty, except when occupied by swarms of bewildered tour-bus victims. Breakfast is OK but not in the league of the international chains. This place describes itself as a business hotel so if you can get a good price it's a reliable choice. No local character though, and not a particularly pleasant part of town, unless you're interested in traffic.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: xoTR
Reviews.Content: İts in the center of the city 2 minutes walk to metro 5 mınutes walk to Colosseum İts clean İts a little noisy after 9 A.M ( its under contraction but not at night ) very nice crew excellent breakfast couldnt connect wifi hehe (my problem) WC is not small as others say its secure and really enjoyed to be next to Colosseum For Türkish people I say " Süper "

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel very near Coliseum”
Reviews.Author: blueken
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from this hotel and it was great. very central and they upgraded our room foc to the 8th floor (809), very quiet lovely balcony and kingsize bed and enormous modern bathroom. the food was lovely and the staff where very helpful, especially Nino, very honest too, my husband left his (very expensive) chain and medals in the room after we checked out and the maid rang down to catch us before we left.Would highly recommend the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Friendly staff, Brilliant Breakfast”
Reviews.Author: lyana
Reviews.Content: We stayed here from 18 Dec - 21 Dec 2006 for a family trip. Based on this website, I think this hotel is great in location and give good value. So, decided to try it although it is slightly underrated. We were absolutely right & happy with our decision LOCATION The location is the main feature to this hotel It is just 5 mins walk to Rome Forum, Rome Palatino and Viazza Venezia. 10 mins walk to Colloseum, Via Del Corso (shopping district) 20 mins walk to Trevi Fountain, Piazza Navonna and The Pantheon The only 2 place that need to take the buses or Metro is the Vatican City and the Spanish Step! We really enjoy walking in Rome as everything is very near and very easy to get to There are lots of restaurants and cafes in surrounding area, we tried 2 of the italian restaurants and it was good. The indian restaurant right in front of the hotel is fantastic as well! served fantastic Beriani. Lots of groceries shop and souvenir shop. No need to buy souvenir elsewhere - its cheaper in this area!!! ROOM Book 3 standard classic room and we were given 3 neighbouring room with 2 connecting room which is just fantastic. We booked through the hotel website which offers fantastic price - £98 per nite per room which is very good value. The room is quite big in size and there is even a round coffee table with 2 chairs for sitting and relaxing. The tv has lots of channels in italian and 3 english channels which is BBC, CNN & MTV and I think there's 1 english movie channel (haven't had time to watched it!) BREAKFAST The breakfast was included in the package and it is fantastic! There are scramble eggs, poached eggs, smoked salmon, brilliant choice of pastries, breads, cereals, fruits, juices, cheeses and the choice of any hot drinks that you want - either its cappucino or Latte! STAFF The staff there were brilliant! Very friendly, always there to help you and there is 1 staff that worth the mention - his name is Roberto. He is great! Very very nice, warmth, he's like a friend -help us around in getting to the attraction places and in letting us know which bus to take and everything. So next time you were in the hotel - find Roberto! DISLIKE The only thing that we didn't like about the hotel is the old, plain design of the classic bathroom. I think this need to change - although they have another room called 'designer room' which is very immaculate in design but I think for classic room - the bathroom need to be at least modern & new. Another thing is the noise, room facing the main road will hear some noise from the traffic outside although it will reduce towards the end of the nite. But if your room facing the back road, then noises will not be a problem We think this hotel has been underrated and based on our research on all the hotels in Rome - I think this hotel should be ranked AT LEAST at the 20th place!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: shal227
Reviews.Content: Spent 5 nights here and found it to be very comfortable and location is great. We walked all over Rome from here. Restaurants on street behind hotel are plain but good. Elite grocery is across the street and to the right. Much cheaper for water, soda and snacks than mini bar. Cafe on corner to the right has gelato and big cappacinos. Would return anytime.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Hollette
Reviews.Content: This hotel is a good 3*, very clean, nice decor, nice breakfast, fantastic location very close to the Termini (15mins walk) and Colleseum (5mins walk). Also close to several nice tavernas and cafe bars - in which to soak up the Roman atmosphere. I would have no qualms returning or recommending the hotel. Only down point is very minor - only english channels available were CNN & MTV - but who goes to Rome to watch TV?! December was a great time to visit - the weather is much milder than the UK, it actually hit 20 degrees celecius when we were there. The crowds are far less than at more popular times - but it is still wise to get to attractions on the early side as there are still queues. Also be wary of Dec 8th which is a bank holiday for them and the Vatican closes all day. However everything else appeared to be open. In my mind we could not have chosen a better hotel for our 3 nights.

Reviews.Title: “Great place for tourists to stay”
Reviews.Author: Scodlin
Reviews.Content: We arrived at the Hotel palatino and were pleasantly surprised. LOCATION The best aspect of the hotel is its location. It is in the heart of anciet Rome just a few blocks from the Roman Forum and the Colossium. Less than a block away is a metro station and Rome's (grand central) Termini is less than a mile away. CCOMFORTABLE The hotel lobby, room and bathroom were quite comfortable. The standard of hotel is comparable to Hyatt in the USA with nicely appointed rooms. The bath was adequate with a full tub, large granite sink countertop and a bidet in addition to the toilet. Housekeeping was well done. Large, decent, fresh smelling, clean towels being provided daily. The sheets were crisp and clean and pleasant smelling. The maids were kind and accommadating. Toiletries were replenished daily. BREAKFAST Breakfast was laid out buffet style from 6:30 am to 10:00am. It was expanded contentental fare. On the menu were fruits such as canned peached, pears, prunes and fresh apple, grapes and like fare. There were a variety of baked goods including croissants, muffins, breads and an array of condiments. As for meats, there was smoked salmon, ham, bacon and the Italian style pork and beef.
