Fresh juices, coffee and tea rounded out the lot. The breakfast was surely adequate to get any vacationer up and running for the day. it was pleatiful in variety and volume of items. SERVICE I found the hotel staff to be pleasant. The front desk attendants were all fluent in English and were helpful to us in giving directions, making restaurant selections and reservations. AVOID Try to arrange transportation to and from the airport at reduced rates in the USA. We needed to be at the airport at 6:00am for our return flight to the USA. The hotel's "car service" turned out to be limousine service for which we spent 65 Euros with tip. We paid 12 Euros transportation from the Airport to the hotel so this was alot to spend on airport transportation.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location in Rome”
Reviews.Author: ChuckB~NJ
Reviews.Content: Just got back from a week in Rome. Grand Hotel Palatino was very nice. Front Desk staff was helpful and friendly. They offered restuarants that were nice and reasonably priced and assisted with getting around the city. Rooms were nice but not overly decorated. Hotel safe was free but small. When you sleep with the window open you did hear street noise but that is to be expected. Closed the noise was better. Beware of the Metro.. Had wallet stolen from my front pocket. People push uncontrollably on the subway and low and behold, your wallet will be gone. Reported it to the police and others were there with the same problem. Tour guide said it happens to her about three times a year. It usually is the Gypsies or South Americans that take your wallet. In Rome there are a lot of beggers. These are not Italians they are the Eastern Europeans and usually Gypsies. They are really annoying. Overall we had a great time. If you have any questions, please let me know..

Reviews.Title: “Great base for a city break”
Reviews.Author: grey.dave
Reviews.Content: We walked in off the street to check this place as an alternative to the unsatisfactory apartment we had intended to stay in. We were agreeably surprised by the rate (Euro 150 per room incl breakfast), delighted by the rooms, and moved straight in. We had one of the upgraded rooms, almost a mini-suite, and it was superb. Beautifully cleaned, very quiet, all the amenities. Breakfast was fine and varied. The hotel had put independent travellers in a separate room from the tour groups, which was a blessing. Location is superb. Colosseum, Forum, St Pietri in Vincoli all in easy walk. Metro station very close by, buses galore, and the main Termini rail station only 15 minutes away. Overall this was a great base for a week in Rome, and would be very hard to beat at the rate we paid.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location!”
Reviews.Author: mkennedy38
Reviews.Content: We stayed 3 nights in Mar. Our stay was completed without incident. The front desk is VERY busy but the staff was polite once you got your turn. The lobby was small and congested. The restaurant was delicious, classy and the buffet breakfast was good also. The rooms are tidy, clean, and well supplied. However the hotel in general was hot. The AC in the room needed some attention. We had to sleep with the window open. Which was a minus because Via Cavour is a very busy street. The location was great. It was in easy walking distance to many of the piazzas, the Forum, Colosseum, and Metro.

Reviews.Title: “A week at the Palatino”
Reviews.Author: paddyr
Reviews.Content: My family and i spent a week at this hotel. We found the staff to be be helpful, the breakfasts palatable, anf the rooms adequate. The location is excellant for walking to the Coliseum and the Forum. We walked to the Pantheon, Trevi fountain, and Spanish Steps and took the metro back to Cavour. The Vatican is a bit of a hike..2 miles. The Elite supermarket is up the street...good for wine, beer , cheese, delicatessen etc. Irish pub literally behind the hotel..good for local info....bar staff from Northern Ireland. Decent restaurants in area...best one we found was La Mella D'Ora ( the Golden Apple) about a 10 minute walk left out of the hotel. If you want to focus on Ancient Rome, then this is a very good location. The local area has a pharmacy, post office, internet cafe, numerous restaurants, dollar(Euro) store. We found the Hotel to be better than what many of the previous posters/reviewers had led me to believe.

Reviews.Title: “Huge disappointment”
Reviews.Author: shakergrandma
Reviews.Content: Hotel Palentino was an outdated hotel and a huge disappointment. It was near the Coliseum, which is not a very good neighborhood. The rooms were very dirty, and had big stains on the carpeting and chairs. I am convinced that one in the corner was a urine stain. The bed was 2 junior beds pushed together and called a king. I am only 5’4” and my feet touched the end of the bed! My husband is 6’3” so you can imagine how difficult it was for him to sleep. When we asked for another room, we were told that there was nothing available. We were spending a week at this hotel (because a of a business convention) so my husband was pretty demanding, we were finally given a better room with a regular sized bed and no stains! We will never, ever stay at this hotel again, we feel that we were mistreated and found other much nicer hotels near the Spanish Steps. Beware!!!!.

Reviews.Title: “Big, bold and brassy”
Reviews.Author: globalnomad79
Reviews.Content: This was a typical large-scale hotel catering to hordes of tourist groups (you will surely meet them during breakfast). We got a pretty decent deal (paying 150 Euros for a triple room). The room was very spacious (compared to say, a room in Paris) and the bathroom was huge. It was very clean as well. Breakfast was decent. The location was excellent as it's situated in the heart of the ancient center of Rome, just a short walk away from the Coliseum (Colosseo) and the Imperial Forums. It's also not too far from Termini Train Station. If you manage to get a good deal, do stay here otherwise if you're gonna pay a bomb, you're better off staying in other fancier places with much more character and class.

Reviews.Title: “Good location but”
Reviews.Author: leop
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at this hotel in may as part of a Colette Vacation tour....so we did not have any choice about the hotel since it was selected as part of the tour....as everyone else has stated, the location is very good, about two blocks for the colosseum, and two blocks from the forum...it is on a main street but our room was in the back and quiet...the rooms are very ordinary, apparently they have not updated them for at least 20 years. but the room was very clean....the bath was adequate but on the second day there was no water from 5:00 PM until midnight...now, maybe that was because everyone on our tour, all 50 of us, decided to take showers before supper...but this is a tourist hotel and they should be set up to accommodate this kind of thing...we were not the only tour group there at the time, there was at least one other group.....the staff is not very friendly or helpful so don't expect much there....the breakfast was very typical, and located in a fairly large room that is set up for tour groups....there is a fairly nice bar at the hotel and nicely appointed lounge chairs in the lobby area..... In looking at earlier reviews, a restaurant behind the hotel, Roma, was mentioned as a good place to go, so we went there but we were disappointed, I would not go back there...down the street towards the forum, there were a few restaurants that looked like they might have been a better choice..overall, I would not spend serious money to stay here but if you can get a deal, it is in a very good location if you want to see some of the old rome attractions.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, but Not Worth 4 Stars”
Reviews.Author: hemingfan
Reviews.Content: What makes this hotel "grand"? The location. It's two and a half blocks from the Colosseum and the Roman Forum. There are a number of nice little cafes within 5 minutes' walking distance, a coffee shop a few doors down, and a market 50 yards away. St. Peter in Chains is right across the street. The breakfast buffet was extensive and tasty. On the other hand, the dinners at the hotel were mediocre, the staff was not overly friendly, and the fuse in our bedroom kept blowing. I wish I had a dollar for each time I had to reset the breaker. Would I stay there again? Probably, but only because of the location.

Reviews.Title: “Close to Coloseum, Roman Forum and metro”
Reviews.Author: sophiehew
Reviews.Content: Hotel room and toilet is quite roomy considerating you are in Rome. Breakfast was slightly dissappointed since you have to pay extra 15 Euro to get hot breakfast (egg, meat, etc). Location is excellent. Walking distance to Coloseum, Roman Forum, shops, internet and metro station. Be sure to check out Coloseum at night. It just beautiful. There is a chuch across the hotel where Michelangelo's Moses sculpture and the chain of St. Peter is located. For food, check out the chinese restaurant. There are couple in the area. They usually have good selection of food and reasonably price if you tired of pasta, pizza and sandwiches. Prawn and fried rice are usually pretty good. Also try the gelato down the street where they sell Illy coffee. That's one of the best gelato we have in Rome. If you going to see the Pope on Sunday noon, do hold on to your wallet. The place is packed and its full of gypsie kids who will try to get your $$. One guy in our trip caught the kid where 1 in front try to distract him and the other tried to pickpocket from behind. Another man wasn't so lucky, he got pickpocket on the bus. If you like cats, be sure to check out the Cats Santuary in Torre Argentina ruins. The cats there are just so friendly and relax. Most of them love to napped under the tree, others were sun bathing. Its amazing to see so many cats in the same place. The santuary also takes in handicapped cats, its something I've never seen. I heard there is another cat colony in Coloseum.

Reviews.Title: “An Average Hotel”
Reviews.Author: nycurbangirl
Reviews.Content: This hotel was an average experience overall. The hotel overall - was OK- the rooms were comfortable and the location was good. However, for the price I paid (about $350 per night) I found this hotel to be extremely overrated and not worth the money. There was nothing special about the rooms, they are average. The location is pretty good - 10 minute walk to the forum and colosseum; other sights are a 15 minute walk away. The subway station is close by as well. The major problem we had was that the AC did not work in our room, and the hotel preferred to "fix rather than give us a new room." It was only after we insisted on a new room that it was given to us. The hotel staff was not helpful through this process and one person at the desk rudely asked us "why are you here?". The staff was also not very knowledgeable about sights and information and we were given incorrect information a few times. I would not stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “The Grand Palatino Hotel - Good Choice”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I just returned from a week-long trip to Rome and stayed at the Grand Palatino Hotel. It is at a great location, located down the block from the Metro station (via Cavour) and one stop away from the main Termini station, which is walkable, but not suggested with luggage. The Colosseum, Forum and Palatine Hill is only about 10 minutes away. There is also a bus stop a few steps away, but not sure what bus # stops there. The rooms are kept clean with hairdryer, safe, refrigerator and usual amenities of shampoos, soaps, shoe polisher, etc, which are re-stocked daily. We had a triple bed room which was very comfortable. The hotel is however on a very busy street, so do expect traffic noise when the windows are open, especially if your room is facing the front and if you are there over a weekend. Lots of restaurants closeby (behind on the small streets). They do serve a good daily breakfast spread (scrambled eggs, bacon, sliced coldcuts, smoked salmon, croissants, danishs, bread, cereals, fruit, etc). The front desk is cordial, but I did not find them especially friendly or helpful when we inquired about specific tourist sites and asked for help in making reservations to museums. There is a grocery store (Elite) across the street and another smaller convenience store down the block where we bought water and soda for reasonable prices. However, I do suggest that you make sure what they charge you at the cash register is correct against the shelf prices. We did almost get charged double when we bought only 2 items! There is internet service available in the individual rooms, but I believe usage needs to be set-up with the front desk so that the charges can be recorded. There are also 2 computers in the lounge on the lobby level, and you can access the internet using a credit card. In summary, all-in-all, I would definitely recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: travellingwithtwo
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Grand Palatino for our belated honeymoon at the end of March. Our room number was 813, the 8th and top floor. We had the executive suite which was only 10 euros extra per night. Our King sized bed had comfortable, firm mattresses. We had a beautiful balcony with automatic shutters that faced via de Cavour. The shutters greatly reduced the sound from the streets. Our room and bathroom didn't feel cramped at all and was very clean. They supplied us with lots of toiletries, slippers and robes. The room also had a closet, safe, chairs and table, bathtub, and bidet. A large breakfast buffet was included every morning. The dining room was bright, clean and well decorated. Breakfast included bacon, eggs, breads, cereals, yoghurt, cold cuts, cheese, and drinks. Of course, the food is best and freshest if you don't wait until the end. Also, this menu was served everyday, so we were quite tired of it by Day 4. The staff in the dining room did not speak English, nor the maids, but anyone behind the concierge and check-in counter spoke very well. The downfalls: 1) We were fortunate that the weather was very beautiful when we were there at the end of March. It was quite warm which also made the room a little too hot for sleeping at night. I had no problems sleeping, but my husband requires cooler temperatures. With the terrace doors open to the balcony, a nice flow of air cooled down the room, BUT via de Cavour is a very, very busy and noisy street at any hour. It was impossible to sleep with the constant honking and roaring of cars, motorcycles and scooters. Plus our air conditioning unit did not work. We complained on the 2nd to last day, which was probably too late. They claimed to have looked at it while we were out, but it was not fixed. 2) A very minor thing: the shower is only meant for short people! The shower hose is attached to the bathtub nozzle. If fully extended to accommodate people over 6 feet tall (like my husband) or even 5'5 (like myself) then the hose bends and the water cannot go through. Either take a bath, or hold on to the shower head, using it like a spray. Otherwise, we were very happy with this hotel. As other people have mentioned, the location is excellent! It's about two blocks away from the Colosseum, Palantine Hill and Forums and the subway is just around the corner. We tried the subway once at 8am to get to the Vatican. It was so packed, everyone was pushing their way onto the train. I don't recommend it, at least not at that hour. Plus, by the time we got to the Vatican, it was already a 45min line-up waiting for us. We managed to walk everywhere, although tiring, well-worth it.

Reviews.Title: “Location, Location, LOCATION!!!!”
Reviews.Author: dolphin80
Reviews.Content: Three words to describe this hotel: LOCATION, LOCATION, LOCATION! We stayed here for a week from 29 March to 05 April 2006. It could not have been more perfect. You’re within a stone’s throw of the Coliseum, the Forum, and Palatine Hill. You’re on Cavour Street, which has every amenity you would ever need. Cavour Street is a very busy street, but the Grand Hotel Palatino offers refuge from the hustle & bustle of Rome. There is a very clean lobby and attentive staff. My wife and I arrived at 12pm expecting to be told our room wouldn’t be ready (based on prior reviews). To our surprise, our room was ready and located on the 7th floor facing the rear of the hotel. (Much quieter than facing Cavour St. – make this request if possible) The room was smallish compared to U.S. standards, but who cares? All we were looking for was a comfortable room in which to sleep, shower, & change. We had comfortable beds with extra blankets if needed. The bathroom, although a bit on the small side, was just fine. We had decent water pressure with hot water all the time. As for TV, it is free, but your channel choices are limited, with the only english channel being CNN International. You’re not in Rome to watch TV though!! There’s a myriad of establishments on the small side streets around and especially behind the hotel. Immediately in the hotel’s vicinity, you have Café Borghia, which is immediately to the right as you exit the hotel. They have an extremely friendly staff and delicious food & desserts. If you exit the hotel, turn right, and then turn right again down the steps, you’ll find an Irish pub on the left and the Ragna’ De Oro restaurant directly in front. At the bottom of the steps, if you head left, you’ll eventually come to a great restaurant called “La Vecchia Roma.” (Old Rome). It’s filled with locals and nobody speaks english. However, I’ve never had a better plate of carbonara in my life. If you’re looking for some awesome Gelato, exit the hotel, turn right and head down to via Serpenti. Make a right on Via Serpenti, cross the street and pass the church on your left. About 50 yards on your right, you’ll find the cheapest Gelato place in town. Cheap does not mean tasteless either. This was by far the best Gelato we had, and we tried them all, believe me! They will give you an excellent map of Rome when you check into the hotel. This map is about as accurate as they come. It covers every street in Rome where many of the book maps do not. Fold this map up and keep it in your pocket. You can find anything with this map. Even though the hotel is a stone’s throw from the Cavour Metro stop, we never used the metro, took a bus, or used a taxi. If you’re able bodied, you should be walking to all the MUST SEE spots. Via Veneto (Harry’s Bar, Hard Rock, U.S. Embassy) is a 20 minute walk. Trevi Fountain is a 15 minute walk. The Pantheon is a 20 minute walk. Spanish Steps are a 25 minute walk. Castel St. Angelo is 30 minutes. Vatican is 35-40 minutes. Piazza de Popolo & Piazza Navona are all within walking distance. Campo de Fiori is the outdoor market and should not be missed. You’ll be amazed how much ground you can cover. Crossing the street can be a challenge, but if you use a crosswalk, keep your wits about you & take control, you can cross without being challenged. We booked this hotel through Gate One travel. We also booked a few excursions through Gate One that were booked through Carrani locally. The pick ups from the hotel were always 10-15 minutes earlier than scheduled. What they do is pick you up in a small bus, take you to the travel agency which is like the rally point and there you board a larger bus with everybody else. Recommended tours include the Illuminated Rome by Night tour (this helped us catch our bearings immediately), the Vatican Museum tour (does NOT include St. Peters, but you can use the afternoon to explore it), and the day trip to Florence (BEAUTIFUL drive and wonderful city). We also went on the Naples / Pompeii day trip with the main purpose of seeing Pompeii. This was great, but we could have done without the drive through downtown Naples. There really wasn’t much to see and the traffic was horrendous. Would much rather have spent those extra two hours at Pompeii. They also stop at a Cameo factory, which didn’t appeal to us at all. More wasted time at a tourist trap. If you don’t book your tours ahead of time, the hotel can do it for you with a company called Green Line. If you choose to visit a site such as the Coliseum, the Forum, Palatine Hill, the Sistine Chapel, St. Peter’s, or the Vatican Museums WITHOUT a guide, I highly recommend that you purchase a book by Fodor’s, Frommel, or Rome’s 10 Best to guide you. Otherwise, you won’t have a clue what you’re looking at. Believe me, there is a LOT to take absorb when you’re in Rome. You cannot walk 25 feet without stumbling over something of tremendous historical significance. We never asked the hotel personnel for suggestions for anything; for fear that they would just lead us to the tourist traps. You really cannot go wrong by just venturing out on your own. Using the map that the hotel provided, along with some restaurants recommended in the “Rome’s 10 Best” book, we were able to find some delicious spots. The Imperiale restaurant at the intersection of Cavour and Imperiale (go right out of the hotel) had delicious pizza. We never had a problem feeling threatened or having that uneasy, unsafe feeling. Walk like you know where you’re going, and don’t look lost & confused in crowded places. You’ll be fine. Suggest using a money belt or something hidden if you’re going to carry lots of cash. We walked around with 100 Euros on a daily basis and a credit card. Most places accept the plastic and you get the best conversion rate by using it. Tips are included, but we always kicked in a few Euros extra and it’s expected if you’re American. Breakfast at the hotel was very edible. Same setup every single day: Scrambled eggs, undercooked bacon, ham, cheese, croissants, yogurts, coffee, & juice. If you ask nicely, they will make you a cappuccino. Breakfast starts at 6:30am, and unless you want slim pickings later, you should be there between 6:30-7am. The food was good enough to give you and excellent start to your day. Feel free to email me with question. Rome was fantastic!

Reviews.Title: “Location is a real plus!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I have just returned from spending Christmas week at the Grand Palatino with my husband, sister and three adult children. We found the staff very helpful, especially when my husband had a medical emergency and needed an extra mattress on his bed. The breakfast buffet was a great way to start the day. A wonderful selection of breads, yogurts, meat, cheese, fresh fruit and smoked salmon. We never found the dining room too crowded unlike a previous reviewer who said they had to share a table some mornings. We enjoyed eating next door at the Caffe Borghia. The food was good, but we went back because of the friendliness of the waiter, Marco. The rooms were adequate and clean, although the bathroom was a little small. TV service was not free, but as we don't speak Italian, it didn't really matter. There is Internet, but a little expensive, especially as there are about 5 Internet cafes in two blocks near the hotel. The Metro was very convenient, but walking to many prominent sights was very easy, too. I would definitely return to the Grand Palatino

Reviews.Title: “Good but some gripes”
Reviews.Author: Bigendian
Reviews.Content: We booked through Expedia for two rooms adjoining for a family of 4 (two teenagers). The negative bit here was that the rooms were on the east side (151&2) first floor and we did suffer from noise due the restaurants located just below us. Perhaps higher up is less noisy but be aware of that problem. Having said that, we did pay the extra for deluxe rooms and boy were we not disappointed. The room for the kids was nice enough (great bathroom), but then we moved to our room and you got to our bedroom via the sitting room! Combine that with the kids adjoining room and you get two bedrooms and a sitting room with couch and two chairs….luxury indeed. I’d agree with the last review about the staff, or rather the reception. Yes they were very efficient but they weren’t out to win the employee of the year contest. I’m not sure whether it was because they didn’t feel they needed to make the effort or if they just liked being downright rude. Anyway, no harm done as we didn’t need to speak to them very often. Breakfast at the GHP was like all the other hotels we stayed at in Italy although I thought this was the worse with sloppy service and cold coffee, sitting at tables set for an army rather than 4 people. Location was good and some nice restaurants at the bottom of the main road. I wouldn’t bother with the ones close to the hotel as they were too expensive. If you like Chinese though, or just want a cheap meal with cheap but top brand wine, try the restaurant near to the hotel; it’s just down the street on the same side as the hotel. It was not the best Chinese I’ve had but we finished every dish and were still alive the next day! We never asked the hotel staff to recommend places to eat because individual opinions differ so much and you’re never sure if they have some deal with the local restaurants. In terms of tours, it’s pretty obvious that you’re paying top prices for things you can, in the main, do yourself. Having said that, we did succumb to a tout at the Coliseum but boy did that work out. For 8 EUR per adult (you had to pay 10 EUR per adult to get in anyway, but EC kids under 14 were free), we were literally pushed past the queues and were inside listening to the tour guide within 10 minutes. The tour was poor but at least we were inside! The only comment I’d make about the Vatican is get there early, queue up and do it yourself. There are hand held commentary devices to be hired at 6 EUR (remember to take either a passport or driving license) which do the trick and most kids/teenagers will wilt after 30 minutes! As for the hotel, we would stay there again but would ask for rooms on one of the higher floors. Price was reasonable but go that bit further and get the superior rooms

Reviews.Title: “A brilliant stay”
Reviews.Author: Nogre
Reviews.Content: We had pre-booked a car from the hotel to meet us on arrival at Ciampino Airport as our arrival was late evening. It was the start of a brilliant holiday. The driver en route to the hotel took us around some major sites to see them lit up at night giving us a foretaste of our stay. A great hotel situated within easy walking distance of many sites of interest. A very helpful reception and friendly staff. A nice room, but the bathroom although small was adequate. The T.V. had only CNN news, BBC news 24 and internet facilities and films by extra payment. The film start we chose was late and we had a refund. Breakfast buffet in the Dining Room was excellent and satisfied our appetites for the rest of the day. We had dinner one night in the hotel which was great and we received first class service. The hotel was situated within walking distance of many places of interest. You need comfortable shoes however as we did not know where to put our legs and feet after a day of sightseeing. At the Colosseum we were approached by a guide company - Roman Promenades, who were very much cheaper with their tours than those offered at the hotel. These were on foot however except for the Catacombs. The guides were entertaining and very informative. By taking three of their tours to the Vatican (an early start by Metro adjoining the hotel to Ottiavano), Catacombs, Circus Maximus, Marcello Theatre, etc., and night tour to Trevi Fountain, Spanish Steps and Pantheon, there was a 10 euro reduction. Also included was a free 1 hour tour (plus) of the Palatine. If you want to see Galleria Borghese, you have to book in advance - we missed it. Also visit the Church of Saint Clemente, which is three churches in one, built one on top of the other over the centuries. It's near the Colosseum. Oppposite the hotel, up a flight of steps and round the corner is the Church which houses the Chains of St. Peter. At the rear of the hotel to the right up a hundred yards or so is another beauiful church.The National Museum of Rome is also worth a visit, free for children and pensioners. (Warning Museums are closed on Mondays).Also at the rear of the hotel down the steps and adjacent to the Cavour Metro entrance is a great Trattoria, 'Osteria della Suburra'. This will be a holiday to remember.

Reviews.Title: “Grand Hotel Palatino: Nice Stay - but there were some issues”
Reviews.Author: JRS67
Reviews.Content: My husband and I spend 3 nights at the Grand Hotel Palatino at the very begining of October 2005. It cost us 260 Euro per night, breakfast included. The hotel was in a pretty good location. Literally one block from the Colliseum, and 50 yards from the Metro (which can get you pretty much any where you need to go). There are other areas of Rome which are a bit nicer and have better restaurants within walking distance (try anywhere near Plaza Navona or the Trevi Fountain). But for the money, this was a very good, safe, and convenient location (also, one block from the Peter in Chains Church). The room: GREAT, if not fabulous. My husband is 6'3," and he found the room and the bathroom to be plenty big enough for all of his needs. We were on the 8th floor and enjoyed our very own balcony (which was also spacious) which offered breathtaking views of the city - it was magical. Also, absolutely no noise. None. Finally, we had a king - yes, king sized bed. It was heaven. I did notice that this Hotel services a TON of tour groups. They were everywhere. If you get a floor with noisy partygoers, I can see this being a problem. As it was, we did not and thus, we had no issues with the big groups. The staff: not so great. Here are my beefs - the front desk people - not friendly. Helpful, yes, when asked. But not overly friendly. They did arrange a shuttle to the Rome airport for 45 Euro - which I hear is pretty good. However, I also asked at one point for a reasonably priced restauarant suggestion. The concierge happily recommended a restaurant right behind the hotel. We went. It was atrocious. It catered to stupid Americans and overcharged us for really bad food (seriously, this place would not survive in even the most deprived areas of the US). I was pretty fuming that the hotel sent us to such an obviously bad place. He told us to tell them that Nino sent us - we should have been tipped off right there that we were being hoodwinked! Next, we asked for a tour of the vatican (as I had read in various tour books that this was the only way to avoid the maddeningly long lines - NOT SO!!). They happily obliged. The tour was operated by Green Line Tours and cost us 92 Euro. It too was atrocious. The bus arrived one hour late, we did not avoid the 90 minute line (or quere). Because they were late, the tour guide rushed us through, giving us absolutely no value for our money. We were very disappointed. The lesson that we learned from all this - do not trust any suggestions or recommendations from the front desk. It is all bad and is purely designed to take advantage of stupid naive first time overseas travelers like my husband and I. Finally, the breakfast was acceptable. Unlike our hotels in Milan and Florence, we were not offered fresh coffee or cappuccinos. However, they delivered the expected spread - meat, cheeses, cereal, yogurt, pastries, eggs and bacon. The coffee on the table was acceptable - gourmet compared to American standards! So, bottom line - we might stay at Hotel Palatino again because the room was so fabulous and the location was pretty darn convenient. However, we would avoid the staff's recommendations at all costs! We felt ripped off and taken advantage of both of the times we asked the staff for recommendations. Hope this helps. We adored Italy and know you will too!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: stewartsgirl
Reviews.Content: Just returned from Hotel Palatino and would recommend it highly. The location is excellent and we barely scratched the surface of the area surrounding the hotel. So much to see and do in just that area! I cannot say enough about Roberto. Our luggage did not arrive in Rome and Roberto called the airport twice to check for us. He always had a smile and greeting for us and ready to help us with any questions. Our room was lovely and spotless with a beautiful view. We were on the back side of the hotel and never once heard any noise. We couldn't ask for more!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel, great location ... what else can I say?”
Reviews.Author: RetiredFolk
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from 5 days at the Grand Hotel Palatino and just have to give it 5*. The bedroom was great but the bathroom was very small for a 4* hotel and I just do not know how most Americans get to use the toilet! The location is just about perfect for access by train (Metro stop about 2 minutes, Terminii station about 12 minutes walk) and for all the sights of Rome - but then you'll know that from your research on this hotel. Reception staff were completely customer focused with nothing being too much trouble. Checkin was a breeze despite the tailend of a travel group. A couple of problems with the room (the hairdryer hose was split and a light bulb was broken) were repaired as soon as we notified reception. The rooms were very clean, the white fluffy towels were changed every day, as was all the bed linen, and the toiletries were replenished every day as well. The full breakfast was superb - including the fresh fruit and the smoked salmon - and there was always more choice than we could work our way through. Using separate dining rooms for the 'tour group scrum' (round 8 seat tables and entry level buffet food) and individually booked residents changed breakfast into an enjoyable and relaxing start to the day. The car service to the airport (€45 for 2) is much more expensive than the train (€19 for 2) but was a luxury to enjoy on our return in very hot and humid weather, even more so after all the walking we had done to see the sights! We found 3 restaurants near to the hotel which were so good (for different reasons) that we did not need to venture further despite there being many restaurants in the narrow streets behind the hotel. L'Archetto - a wine bar on Via Cavour just around the lefthand bend back towards Terminii station - served absolutely excellent food (try the traditional Italian starter...wow!) but the addition of a 15% service charge on top of the per person cover charge was a step too far which sent the bill into the (entry level) expensive class. La Vecchia Roma - classic Italian trattoria/pizzeria on Via Leonina behind the hotel and left down the street - served very good food (try the gnocci with moules and the homemade pasta ...) with very drinkable table wine (both red and white) at very reasonable prices that we can only dream about in the UK! This restaurant is very popular (no surprise) and by 20-20:30 it is full with a good chance of being turned away. The rule of the 'house' seems to be that you either do it their way or they are not interested in your custom! Go with the flow and enjoy it!! Il Ragno d'Oro - trattoria/pizzeria immediately behind the hotel on Via Leonina - good food, ok table wine and cheap! But on balance, not as good as La Vecchia Roma. Would I stay here again if I returned to Rome ..... absolutely yes.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel in an excellent location”
Reviews.Author: joemo
Reviews.Content: A much belated review of the Hotel Palatino, where I stayed with my wife and daughter for a week in July 2004. The location is ideal - short walk to the Forum and Coliseum, 50m from a metro station, and with a warren of atmospheric back streets behind it. The staff were friendly, efficient and helpful (apart from one waiter in the breakfast room whose grumpiness bordered on being comical). The room, although not large, was very clean, comfortable and well-equipped. Firm beds, decent A/C and no noise problems made for an excellent night's sleep for all of us. Breakfast was quite adequate, and served up to 10.00 a.m. At €108/night B&B for the 3 of us, it was excellent value for money, and I would not hesitate to go back again.

Reviews.Title: “Remarkable Location, Good Hotel”
Reviews.Author: PJ195714
Reviews.Content: When they say its 3 minutes from the Coliseum, it is! Excellent position for all of the old town. Traditional Italian hotel, nice rooms, no problems with service, helpful staff, good breakfasts - what else do you need to know?

Reviews.Title: “Perfectly Adequate”
Reviews.Author: TwinsAunt
Reviews.Content: Stayed at Grand Hotel for 4 nights with husband and 10 year old daughter. The Grand Hotel is on a fairly busy street with a few restaurants and shops -mostly souvenir type shops. There is a metro stop within 50 yards and it is about 10 minute walk to main Termini station. The hotel is extremely convenient for the Colliseum and Forum - within 2 mins of leaving hotel, you can see the Colliseum. To get to Pantheon, Piazza Navona etc probably a 20 min walk (round the pedestrian death trap that is the Piazza Venezia!). While we were there the main entrance was being refurbished. The lobby area is fine with a large bar (largely unused as far as we could see). The hotel seemed to be popular with touring parties (American mostly) and they seemed to fill the restaurant at night. Luggage from buses also filled the lobby frequently. The hotel is traditional with no great architectural features. Our room was on the 5th floor with none of the promised panoramic views over the city as promoted in the hotel literature. The room was spacious with an average sized bathroom. Bath with shower fitting over the top. Nice soft towels. Minimal drawer space for clothes. Our safe in the wardrobe was broken. Everything was very clean. Breakfast was included in our rate. It was buffet style but you had to be out of your bed on time to ensure there was anything left! Bread rolls, croissants, juice, yoghurts, fruit, bacon, scrambled eggs were available. The dining room often got busy and tables could be at a premium. You often had to share with other people as tables sat 8. Front desk staff were helpful with directions etc. The waiting staff at breakast seemed to be non-Italians and you often had to seek out cutlery, request juice machines to be topped up. All in all, a very acceptable 4 star hotel in a good location.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, poor service”
Reviews.Author: Markmywords
Reviews.Content: The Good Location: Near to the Colosseum, Forum and the Metro. Plenty of restaurants in the back streets although none we found were particularly good. The Ok The room was of adequate size and clean. The Bad Our bathroom was small, and the bath miniscule as this doubled as a shower it was quite precarious. The reception staff were all unfriendly and did things grudgingly. Breakfast was very poor. Overall Seems to focus on the package market, personally not somewhere I would return to.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place to Stay Close to Many attactions”
Reviews.Author: eadvisor
Reviews.Content: We stayed for two nights in July. The staff is great. They speak english and are helpful. We arrived by airport and took the train to the city. We then walked about 15 mins to the Hotel. If you get there before 8:00 PM walk, otherwise spend the 7 euro for a cab. The Hotel is close to the Roman Forum (4 Blocks) and the Colosseum (8 Blocks). The breakfast is OK. There is a chinese resturant two blocks down which was good. There is also a post office one block down. I would go back to this Hotel. Have fun.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel and excellent staff”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We have just come back from a five night stay at the Grand Palatino, and I cannot find any faults with this well run and well situated hotel. We were given a family room on the 8th. floor which had the added benefit of having a small balcony with which to enjoy the warm evenings. Our bathroom was well equipped with hairdryer, marble sink and big fluffy bath robes which added a taste of luxury. The bedroom was a good size and featured T.V. internet and mini bar. On leaving the hotel the first morning we turned right then left at the first junction and were greeted with a great view of the Coleseum in the distance (approx.10min walk) Across from the hotel was a great little shop which sold cold drinks, snacks, wine and beer at competive prices. There are many restaurants within easy walking distance of the hotel and include Pizzerias. Indian, Chinese and a superb Argentinian steak house. We booked a cab via the hotel from the airport in advance at a cost of 52 euros but it was money well spent because our driver was waiting patiently outside arrivals for us while other passengers were at long queues at taxi ranks when we left.

Reviews.Title: “You will not be disappointed - Above expectation - Wonderful!!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This is a wonderful, excellent hotel. I have very high standards and cannot be easily pleased. Very clean, food outstanding, staff the most helpful and polite. Location brilliant for all things and great for the evening strolls. Many lovely shops and restaurants well hidden behind the hotel. Walk to locations or a cheap taxi ride away, which is just what you want when on holiday. All staff more than happy to give help or advice on places to visit or restaurant. Our first day, when you’re unsure how to plan route and location. The excellent staff gave us a map and out line the Vatican route to take. He also mapped out for on the way back sites/shops we should take in. The whole day was outstanding and memorable. We would not have known down the side streets are the most wonderful antique and other shops. Great other attractions such as Trevi Fountain the Pantheon also taken in. Covered a lot of ground in our checklist of sites to see. Breakfast was always outstanding. Fresh fruit Salad, Fresh Salmon amongst the selection. All outstanding. You will be hard pushed to find a better place to stay. I booked last minute the night before travel as I read such poor reviews on another hotel-Pinetta Palace Hotel I had booked and cancelled . My 15 year son saved us when he found this wonderful web site providing all travellers with such valuable info. It certainly helped us and I am sure all travellers will be grateful. Thanks to all who made my holiday out of this world. Arrivederci!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent time”
Reviews.Author: RBB-7
Reviews.Content: This is written from the perspective of two couples in their sixties. We just got back from a great stay at the Palatino. Some of the things that were important to us probably wouldnt occur to a couple in their twenties or thirties. For instance -good fast elevators and cabs within 5 minutes. This is a must when you have arthritic knees (there are three steps up from street to lobby). Nino and Roberto behind the desk speak the best english but everyone is helpful and nice. We booked through a Gate 1 travel deal- super cheap- and got the smallest least luxurious rooms. Even so they were plenty large with couch, chair, and king bed. The long narrow bathtub had loads of pressure and hot water and that wierd Roman rounded tub bottom that means hold on for dear life when showering. The important thing is that everything was spotlessly clean all the time! Great free breakfast selections too. Cabs are reasonable but there is also a metro station behind the hotel. The area is great and all the other reviews talk about the big attractions. There are also some local attractions that should be mentioned. If you can walk a half mile, turn left out of the front door and stroll up the Via Cavor to one of the great Roman churches- Santa Maria Magiore. Enjoy the mosiacs and have a cappucino in the square and people watch. There is a taxi stand if you don't want to walk home. As you are walking, about 200ft. from the hotel Via Cavor hooks a left . Right at the hook it says Bar . Go in for great sandwiches and Gelato. 50ft. further is L'Archetto- a really nice cramped wine bar. Great food too! Try the grilled veggie antipasto. We had a teriffic dinner there. Behind the hotel to the right down a long flight of outdoor steps try Ragna D'oro. Great pizza, pasta and local wine. If you really want local turn left at the bottom of the steps and try to find La Vecchia Roma- unbelievable local color . All Romans. Point at the menu. They dont speak a word of english- great fun. Prices? Unbelievable - Antipasto Misto 4e-Bruschetta 1e-Pizza 5e-Osso bucco 10e- lamb-7e. They open at 7:30 and are turning people away by 8:00. The only other thing that we did that I would recommend for two couples is ask Roberto to book a private car for a day for 10 hours . We went to Orvietto and Assissi and got to see some unbelievable sights. 350 euros - pricey but well worth it! Palatino Hotel? We'd go back in a heartbeat. PS Don't forget to walk up the 85 steps to see St. Peter in chains across the street. It has a nice Michelangelo Moses in it. Me? Next time I'm taking a cab!

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Palatino lives up to its Grand name!”
Reviews.Author: eternalroma
Reviews.Content: I just returned from four nights at the Grand Palatino and it is an excellent hotel. The staff were all very friendly and helpful. After a taxi ride from hell we were upgraded by Giovanni to a deluxe room. The hotel is in a nice location for exploring ancient Roma and across the street from the St Peter in Chains Church which has a lovely mural by none other than Michelangelo on the ceiling . If you stay here definitely walk over to the church to see the mural. The Hotel is located on Via Cavour which runs right into Fori Imperiali which will take you right past the Colosseum, the Roman Forum and up to Piazza Venezia and on to the other famous monuments. All of the major tourist sites are easily walkable from the hotel. There are several cafes near the hotel and also a neighborhood market with very reasonable wine prices up about 1/2 block. There is also a bank and ATM on the same block as the hotel and a currency changer within a light stroll of the hotel. I wholeheartedly recommend this hotel and will definitely stay here again on my next trip to the eternal city.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel!!!”
Reviews.Author: Mike625
Reviews.Content: My wife and I spent five nights at this Hotel in late March and were very impressed overall. The location is top-notch, close to most of the major historical sights in Rome. The room was spacious but not very quiet, as we were facing the Via Cavour. It could get pretty noisy at times. The hotel staff was excellent, going out of their way to help with any request. There are a number of good restaurants close to the hotel, one being the Cafe Borgia, which is right next door to the hotel. Overall we felt the hotel was a good value for the money spent.

Reviews.Title: “Lived up to every expectation”
Reviews.Author: SMG52
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Grand Hotel Palatino for a week at Easter 2005 & were very impressed with all aspects - the location was perfect, a couple of minutes from the metro and within walking distance of nearly all the major attractions. The hotel staff were very friendly, helpful and courteous. The room was great, on the 7th flloor, overlooking the Via Cavour, clean, soundproof, ample space, excellent breakfast with plenty of choice. We will definitely return to this hotel when we visit Rome again.

Reviews.Title: “Grand Hotel Palatino is Grand”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Our family spent 10 days traveling in Europe, visiting Rome, Venice, and Paris. Without a doubt, Grand Hotel Palatino in Rome was our favorite hotel. We had two rooms for only 2 nights, but wished we had stayed longer. The hotel is in a great location with the Metro a few steps away and Rome's main train station, Termini, just one Metro stop away. The rooms were clean, nicely decorated, and with a good view of Rome. The staff was extremely helpful and polite making our stay very pleasant. But the real highlight of our stay, and our trip, was dining at the Grand Hotel Palatino. Mr. Sandro Medardi, the restaurant manager, and his staff have created a superb dining experience with painstaking attention to detail and service. Mr. Medardi often went from table to table ensuring his patrons were satisfied, and more than once offered ordering suggestions. His suggestions resulted in superb pasta, eggplant, veal and fish dishes. It is not often you find a hotel restaurant and hotel restaurant host of this caliber.

Reviews.Title: “Highly Recommend Grand Hotel Palatino!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My husband, sister-in-law, and myself just returned from Rome and our wonderful 8 day stay at the Palatino Hotel on Friday, March 11, 2005. What a wonderful choice for a hotel! The location was excellent, excellent, excellent! The Collisseum is only 2 blocks away, as well as the Forum, and they are presently excavating the Roman Market across the road from the Forum. Roberto at the front desk was very friendly and helpful. The breakfast was GREAT! Having traveled to Europe every year for the past 13 years, we found the breakfast that was included to be one of the best we have had. Eggs, bacon, cheese, ham, fresh fruits, as well as a great assortment of breads and sweet breads awaited us every morning. They also had cereals and juices as well as great cappuccino. We looked forward to breakfast each morning. The hotel is so centrally located that we found that taking a taxi wasn't that expensive (the Vantican cost around 6 euro each way). Surely was worth the few extra euro not having to deal with the crowded buses and undergrounds. I can't say enough about how much we enjoyed our stay at this hotel. The bathroom was very nice and the shampoo, bath gel, etc. was replenished each day. If we vacation in Rome again, Palatino Hotel will be the place that we will stay.

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel”
Reviews.Author: munchkins7
Reviews.Content: Thanks for all the information. Glad I made the right decision. I agree with what has posted previously. The hotel is centrally located, between the Colosseum and the Roman Forum. Approximately a 20 minute walk, to the Trevi Fountain, a 25 minute walk to the Spanish Steps and a 35 minute walk to Piazza Del Poplo. My husband I even walked to St. Peter's in about 45 minutes. The breakfast which is filling wanes after a couple of days, but at least it is included in the price of the room. Granted a lot of tours stay there, so it can get a little noisy in the middle of the night, with kids going from room to room. The front desk was very helpful, especially Alessandro, who was very accomodating. Also Luigi, the driver, who picked us up and took us back to the the airport. Prices comparable to taxis. It was a very good feeling seeing someone holding my name, after travelling for 20 hours. Can highly recommend 3 places to eat. One is Angelos, located at 75 Via Gioberti. Food very good and reasonably priced. Daniel, the waiter, is very fun and made the 2 evenings we ate there fun and memorable. Dinner each time we ate there was never more than 35 Euros, including a wine from the wine list, the first night. The second place is, Pizzeria DaBaffeto, located at 114 Governo Veccho, off Piazza Navona. Arguably, the best pizza I have ever eaten. Dinner for two, included, one salad, one order of bruschetta, one large pizza, one medium pizza,(we thought a large would be enough, silly us) one litre of house wine, and the meal came to 21Euros. The third place we went to, for our wdding anniversary, L'Eau Vive, a french restaurant, located at 85 Via Monterone, off Via Corso Emmanuel II, at Largo Aregentina, is a bit pricey, has to be the best french food, I have eaten outside of Paris. The restaurant is run by an order of nuns, and at about 9:30pm, they nuns handed out cards to the dinners and everyone sang "Ava Maria". Truly beautiful moment. Dinner came to 73Euros. It included, one bottle of water, a bottle of wine, a salad, soup, an order of escagot, 2 entrees, espresso and 2 dessets. Rome is wonderful. You easily burn off all the food and wine from all the walking. Enjoy!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Just returned from Rome on Sunday. We selected this hotel on the strength of the reviews from this website and were more than pleased by it. It was only two blocks from the Forum & the Colosseum, the staff was excellent, and the breakfast beat any free hotel breakfast I've ever had. Moreover, the room was plenty warm for January, we had extra blankets in our closet, the shower was actually tall enough for my 6'2 husband (very unusual in Europe), and the safe in our room worked. Both the room and the bathroom were quite large, too. My only one small complaint is that the bed was a bit hard. It didn't prevent us from sleeping--the 9 hour time difference saw to that--but for someone not suffering from severe jet lag it might be a tad uncomfortable. We would definitely stay here again, though. Lively but safe neighborhood with some excellent restaurants nearby.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, Great Location”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My five friends and I just returned from our week stay at the Palatino Hotel in Rome. What a great Hotel. The staff was very friendly and helpful. Nino at the front desk was great. He recommended restuarants and even provided us with a car and driver for a day trip that ended up being cheaper than taking a train. We visited Pompeii and the Amalfi Coast. The Hotel is right next to the Cavour Metro station, so getting around was easy with our weekly pass. The rooms were typical for a European hotel room, small but nice. Also very quiet. The Breakfast was not great, but good. It was just what I expected. Good bread. I would highly recommend this hotel for anyone going to Rome. Location is great and the Staff was excellent.

HotelInfo.Name: Palatino Grand Hotel Rome
HotelInfo.Address: Via Cavour 213-M, 00184 Rome, Italy
